02138     new_coords[i] = new_coords[i] - orig_coords[i];
02139   }
02140 
02141   //new_coords now done. Have it absorbed into variable
02142   rc=fc_setVariableDataPtr(displacement_var, numVertex, dim, 
02143                   FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_MT_VECTOR, FC_DT_DOUBLE,
02144                   new_coords);
02145   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) {
02146     free(new_coords);
02147     return rc;
02148   }
02149 
02150   return FC_SUCCESS;
02151   
02152 }
02153 
02154 //@}
02155 
02156 
02157 
02158 
02159 
02160 
02161 
02162 /** \name Get existing meshes. */
02163 //-------------------------------
02164 //@{
02165 
02166 /**
02167  * \ingroup  Mesh
02168  * \brief  Get the meshes in a dataset.
02169  *
02170  * \description
02171  *  
02172  *   This call returns an array of meshes in the dataset. The caller is
02173  *   responsible for freeing the array of sequence handles.
02174  *
02175  * \modifications  
02176  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
02177  *   - July 23, 2002  W Koegler  Changed so it no longer makes safcover calls
02178  *   - 11/21/03 RM, added default return nmeshes = -1, and meshnames = NULL 
02179  *                    if anything is wrong
02180  *   - 9/8/04 WSK, changed to return mesh handles instead of mesh
02181  *               names.
02182  */
02183 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshes(
02184  FC_Dataset dataset,  /**< input - dataset */
02185  int *numMesh,        /**< output - number of meshes returned */
02186  FC_Mesh **meshes     /**< output - array of meshes */
02187 ) {
02188   int i;
02189   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
02190   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02191   
02192   // default return values
02193   if (numMesh != NULL) 
02194     *numMesh = -1;
02195   if (meshes != NULL)
02196     *meshes = NULL;  
02197   
02198   // check input
02199   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
02200   if (dsSlot == NULL || numMesh == NULL || meshes == NULL) {
02201     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02202     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02203   }
02204   
02205   // log message
02206   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting meshes from dataset '%s'",
02207                       dsSlot->header.name);
02208   
02209   // get num meshes
02210   *numMesh = dsSlot->numMesh;
02211   
02212   // get meshes
02213   if (dsSlot->numMesh > 0) {
02214     *meshes = malloc(sizeof(FC_Mesh)*dsSlot->numMesh);
02215     if (*meshes == NULL) {
02216       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02217       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02218     }
02219     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
02220       meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(dsSlot->meshIDs[i]);
02221       _FC_GET_HANDLE((*meshes)[i], meshSlot);
02222     }
02223   }
02224   
02225   return FC_SUCCESS;
02226 }
02227 
02228 /**
02229  * \ingroup  Mesh
02230  * \brief  Get the the number of meshes in a dataset.
02231  *
02232  * \modifications  
02233  *   - 9/28/04 WSK, created.
02234  */
02235 FC_ReturnCode fc_getNumMesh(
02236  FC_Dataset dataset,  /**< input - dataset */
02237  int *numMesh         /**< output - number of meshes returned */
02238 ) {
02239   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
02240   
02241   // default return values
02242   if (numMesh != NULL) 
02243     *numMesh = -1;
02244   
02245   // check input
02246   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
02247   if (dsSlot == NULL || numMesh == NULL) {
02248     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02249     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02250   }
02251   
02252   // log message
02253   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of meshes from dataset '%s'",
02254                       dsSlot->header.name);
02255   
02256   // get num meshes
02257   *numMesh = dsSlot->numMesh;
02258   
02259   return FC_SUCCESS;
02260 }
02261 
02262 /**
02263  * \ingroup  Mesh
02264  * \brief  Get all meshes with a given name from the dataset.
02265  *
02266  * \description
02267  *  
02268  *    Returns all meshes on the dataset with the specified name.
02269  *
02270  * \modifications  
02271  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
02272  *   - 2003-MAY-30  W Koegler  Moved getting mesh meta data from 
02273  *       _fc_setupDsSlot() to here. Moved getting variable meta data 
02274  *       to fc_openVariable().
02275  *   - 11/25/03 RM, added default return mesh = \ref FC_NULL_MESH
02276  *   - 11/26/03 RM, added checking for invalid mesh name, issue error if 
02277  *        fc_getLibraryVerbosity()  
02278  *   - 12/03/03 RM  added checking for parameter mesh == NULL 
02279  *   - 12/12/03 RM, eliminated _fc_lookup_meshSlot() and _fc_namematch()
02280  *       those input checking changed and added into this function  
02281  *   - 9/8/03 WSK, changed name and moved to dataset (to be next to
02282  *       fc_getMeshes) 
02283  *   - 9/21/06 ACG, now returns all meshes with matching names
02284  */
02285 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshByName(
02286   FC_Dataset dataset, /**< input - dataset handle */
02287   char *meshname,     /**< input - name of mesh to get */
02288   int *numMeshes,       /**< output - number of matching meshes */
02289   FC_Mesh **meshes       /**< output - array of mesh handles */
02290 ) {
02291   int i;
02292   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
02293   _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
02294   FC_Mesh mesh;
02295 
02296   FC_Mesh *lmatch = NULL;
02297   int numlmatch, maxnumlmatch;
02298   
02299   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02300   if (numMeshes)
02301     *numMeshes = -1;
02302   if (meshes)
02303     *meshes = NULL;
02304   
02305   // check input
02306   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
02307   if (dsSlot == NULL || meshname == NULL || !meshes || !numMeshes) {
02308     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02309     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02310   }
02311   
02312   // log message
02313   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting mesh '%s'", meshname);
02314 
02315   numlmatch = 0;
02316   maxnumlmatch = 0;
02317   
02318   // look for existing slots with the matching name
02319   for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
02320     meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(dsSlot->meshIDs[i]);
02321     if (!strcmp(meshSlot->header.name, meshname)) {
02322       _FC_GET_HANDLE(mesh, meshSlot);
02323 
02324       if (lmatch == NULL){
02325      lmatch = (FC_Mesh*)malloc(sizeof(FC_Mesh));
02326      if (lmatch == NULL){
02327        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02328        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02329      }
02330      numlmatch = 1;
02331      maxnumlmatch = 1;
02332      lmatch[0] = mesh;
02333       }else{
02334      if(numlmatch == maxnumlmatch){
02335        FC_Mesh *temp;
02336        temp = (FC_Mesh*)realloc(lmatch,(2*numlmatch)*sizeof(FC_Mesh));
02337        if (temp == NULL){
02338          fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02339          return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02340        }
02341        maxnumlmatch*=2;
02342        lmatch = temp;
02343      }
02344      lmatch[numlmatch] = mesh;
02345      numlmatch++;
02346       }
02347     }
02348   }
02349 
02350   *numMeshes = numlmatch;
02351   *meshes = lmatch;
02352 
02353   return FC_SUCCESS;
02354 }
02355 
02356 //@}
02357 
02358 /** \name Change the name of a mesh. */
02359 //-------------------------------
02360 //@{
02361 
02362 /**
02363  * \ingroup Mesh
02364  * \brief  Change the name of a mesh.
02365  *
02366  * \modifications
02367  *   - 8/24/2005 WSD. Created.
02368  */
02369 FC_ReturnCode fc_changeMeshName(
02370   FC_Mesh mesh, /**< Input - the mesh. */
02371   char* newName       /**< Input - new name for the mesh. */
02372 ) {
02373   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02374 
02375   // check input
02376   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02377   if (meshSlot == NULL || newName == NULL) {
02378     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02379     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02380   }
02381 
02382   // log message
02383   fc_printfLogMessage("Changing name of mesh from '%s' to '%s'", 
02384                       meshSlot->header.name, newName);
02385   
02386   // Do it
02387   return _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&meshSlot->header, newName);
02388 }
02389 
02390 //@}
02391 
02392 /** \name Release/delete meshes. */
02393 //-------------------------------
02394 //@{
02395 
02396 /**
02397  * \ingroup Mesh
02398  * \brief Attempt to minimize mesh's memory usage.
02399  *
02400  * \description
02401  *
02402  *    Call to try to release un-needed memory in a mesh. If the mesh has been
02403  *    saved to disk, the large data is released. If the mesh has not be saved
02404  *    to disk, all large data is saved.
02405  *
02406  *    If internal mesh structures like elements and vertices exists, they
02407  *    may be freed as long as there are no subsets or variables associated with
02408  *    edges or faces.
02409  *
02410  *    This function will recursively call release on it's child subsets and
02411  *    variables
02412  *
02413  * \modifications
02414  *    - 9/27/04 WSK Created.
02415  *    - 03/07/08 ACG seq subsets
02416  */
02417 FC_ReturnCode fc_releaseMesh(
02418  FC_Mesh mesh       /**< input - mesh handle */
02419 ) {
02420   int i;
02421   int *numSteps;
02422   FC_Subset *subsets, **seqSubsets;
02423   FC_Variable *variables, **seqVariables;
02424   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02425   FC_AssociationType assoc;
02426   int usingEdge, usingFace, numSubset, numVar, numSeqVar, numSeqSub;
02427   
02428   // special case: releasing a null handle is not an error
02429   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, FC_NULL_MESH)) {
02430     fc_printfWarningMessage("Releasing FC_NULL_MESH");
02431     return FC_SUCCESS;
02432   }
02433 
02434   // check input
02435   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02436   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
02437     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02438     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02439   }
02440   
02441   // log message
02442   fc_printfLogMessage("Cleaning up mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
02443 
02444   // call release on children subsets & variables
02445   // also note whether any children use edges or faces
02446   usingEdge = 0;
02447   usingFace = 0;
02448   fc_getSubsets(mesh, &numSubset, &subsets);
02449   for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++) {
02450     fc_releaseSubset(subsets[i]);
02451     fc_getSubsetInfo(subsets[i], NULL, NULL, &assoc);
02452     if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE)
02453       usingEdge = 1;
02454     else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE) 
02455       usingFace = 1;
02456   }
02457   free(subsets);
02458   fc_getSeqSubsets(mesh, &numSeqSub, &numSteps, &seqSubsets);
02459   for (i = 0; i < numSeqSub; i++) {
02460     fc_releaseSeqSubset(numSteps[i], seqSubsets[i]);
02461     fc_getSubsetInfo(seqSubsets[i][0], NULL, NULL, &assoc);
02462     if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE)
02463       usingEdge = 1;
02464     else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE) 
02465       usingFace = 1;
02466   }
02467   free(numSteps);
02468   for (i = 0; i < numSeqSub; i++)
02469     free(seqSubsets[i]);
02470   free(seqSubsets);
02471   fc_getVariables(mesh, &numVar, &variables);
02472   for (i = 0; i < numVar; i++) {
02473     fc_releaseVariable(variables[i]);
02474     fc_getVariableInfo(variables[i], NULL, NULL, &assoc, NULL, NULL); 
02475     if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE)
02476       usingEdge = 1;
02477     else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE) 
02478       usingFace = 1;
02479   }
02480   free(variables);
02481   fc_getSeqVariables(mesh, &numSeqVar, &numSteps, &seqVariables);
02482   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++) {
02483     fc_releaseSeqVariable(numSteps[i], seqVariables[i]);
02484     fc_getVariableInfo(seqVariables[i][0], NULL, NULL, &assoc, NULL, NULL); 
02485     if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE)
02486       usingEdge = 1;
02487     else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE) 
02488       usingFace = 1;
02489   }
02490   free(numSteps);
02491   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++)
02492     free(seqVariables[i]);
02493   free(seqVariables);
02494              
02495   // remove coords & conns if this slot is committed (they can be reloaded)
02496   if (meshSlot->header.committed == 1) {
02497     free(meshSlot->coords);
02498     meshSlot->coords = NULL;
02499     free(meshSlot->elemToVertConns);
02500     meshSlot->elemToVertConns = NULL;
02501   }
02502  
02503   //-- remove parent lists
02504   free(meshSlot->numEdgePerVert);
02505   meshSlot->numEdgePerVert = NULL;
02506   if (meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert)
02507       for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numVertex; i++)
02508         free(meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert[i]);
02509   free(meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert);
02510   meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
02511   //--
02512   free(meshSlot->numFacePerVert);
02513   meshSlot->numFacePerVert = NULL;
02514   if (meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert)
02515     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numVertex; i++)
02516       free(meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert[i]);
02517   free(meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert);
02518   meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
02519   //--
02520   free(meshSlot->numElemPerVert);
02521   meshSlot->numElemPerVert = NULL;
02522   if (meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert)
02523     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numVertex; i++)
02524       free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert[i]);
02525   free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert);
02526   meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
02527   //--
02528   free(meshSlot->numElemPerEdge);
02529   meshSlot->numElemPerEdge = NULL;
02530   if (meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge)
02531     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numEdge; i++)
02532       free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge[i]);
02533   free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge);
02534   meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
02535   //--
02536   free(meshSlot->numElemPerFace);
02537   meshSlot->numElemPerFace = NULL;
02538   if (meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace)
02539     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numFace; i++)
02540       free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace[i]);
02541   free(meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace);
02542   meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
02543 
02544   //-- remove neighbor lists
02545   free(meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge);
02546   meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
02547   if (meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge)
02548     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numVertex; i++)
02549       free(meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge[i]);
02550   free(meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge);
02551   meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
02552   //--
02553   free(meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert);
02554   meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
02555   if (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert)
02556     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numElement; i++)
02557       free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert[i]);
02558   free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert);
02559   meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
02560   //--
02561   free(meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge);
02562   meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
02563   if (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge)
02564     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numElement; i++)
02565       free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge[i]);
02566   free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge);
02567   meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
02568   //--
02569   free(meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace);
02570   meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
02571   if (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace)
02572     for (i = 0; i < meshSlot->numElement; i++)
02573       free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace[i]);
02574   free(meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace);
02575   meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
02576 
02577   // if no subsets or variables use edges or faces, conns & associated data
02578   // do this last because we might want numEdge or numFace
02579   if (!usingEdge) {
02580     free(meshSlot->edgeToVertConns);
02581     meshSlot->edgeToVertConns = NULL;
02582     free(meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns);
02583     meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = NULL;
02584     //-- set edges back to "unknown"
02585     meshSlot->numEdge = -1;
02586   }
02587   if (!usingFace) {
02588     free(meshSlot->faceTypes);
02589     meshSlot->faceTypes = NULL;
02590     free(meshSlot->numVertPerFace);
02591     meshSlot->numVertPerFace = NULL;
02592     free(meshSlot->faceToVertConns);
02593     meshSlot->faceToVertConns = NULL;
02594     free(meshSlot->elemToFaceConns);
02595     meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = NULL;
02596     free(meshSlot->elemFaceOrients);
02597     meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = NULL;
02598     //-- set faces back to "unknown"
02599     meshSlot->numFace = -1;
02600   }
02601 
02602   return FC_SUCCESS;
02603 }
02604 
02605 /**
02606  * \ingroup  Mesh
02607  * \brief  Delete a mesh.
02608  *
02609  * \description
02610  *  
02611  *    Call when this mesh is no longer needed. This automatically deletes
02612  *    all of the mesh's subsets and variables.
02613  *
02614  *
02615  * \modifications 
02616  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
02617  *    - 12/01/03 WSK Changed so it removes an uncommitted mesh
02618  *      form the owning dataset's meshID list.
02619  *    - 12/03/03 RM, added more input checking, if mesh is FC_NULL_MESH,
02620  *         then do nothing and return success 
02621  *        (issue warning if fc_getLibraryVerbosity()). 
02622  *    - 9/9/04 WSK changed name to delete. Changed behavior so that
02623  *      delete always deletes no matter whether on disk or not.
02624  *    - 03/04/08 ACG added deleting seq subsets
02625   */
02626 FC_ReturnCode fc_deleteMesh(
02627  FC_Mesh mesh       /**< input - mesh handle */
02628 ) {
02629   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02630   int i, j;
02631   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02632   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
02633   int numSubset, numVar, numSeqVar, *numStepPerVar, numSeqSub, *numStepPerSub;
02634   FC_Subset *subsets, **seqSubsets;
02635   FC_Variable *variables, **seqVariables;
02636 
02637   // special case: deleting a null handle is not an error
02638   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, FC_NULL_MESH)) {
02639     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_MESH");
02640     return FC_SUCCESS;
02641   }
02642 
02643   // check input
02644   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02645   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
02646     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02647     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02648   }
02649  
02650   // log message
02651   fc_printfLogMessage("Deleting mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
02652 
02653   // delete member subsets
02654   rc = fc_getSubsets(mesh, &numSubset, &subsets);
02655   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02656     return rc;
02657   for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++) {
02658     rc = fc_deleteSubset(subsets[i]);
02659     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02660       return rc;
02661   }
02662   free(subsets);
02663 
02664   // delete member seq subs
02665   rc = fc_getSeqSubsets(mesh, &numSeqSub, &numStepPerSub, &seqSubsets);
02666   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02667     return rc;
02668   for (i = 0; i < numSeqSub; i++) {
02669     rc = fc_deleteSeqSubset(numStepPerSub[i], seqSubsets[i]);
02670     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02671       return rc;
02672   }
02673   free(numStepPerSub);
02674   for (i = 0; i < numSeqSub; i++)
02675     free(seqSubsets[i]);
02676   free(seqSubsets);
02677 
02678   // delete member variables
02679   rc = fc_getVariables(mesh, &numVar, &variables);
02680   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02681     return rc;
02682   for (i = 0; i < numVar; i++) { 
02683     rc = fc_deleteVariable(variables[i]);
02684     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02685       return rc;
02686   }
02687   free(variables);
02688   
02689   // delete member seq vars
02690   rc = fc_getSeqVariables(mesh, &numSeqVar, &numStepPerVar, &seqVariables);
02691   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02692     return rc;
02693   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++) {
02694     rc = fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStepPerVar[i], seqVariables[i]);
02695     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02696       return rc;
02697   }
02698   free(numStepPerVar);
02699   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++)
02700     free(seqVariables[i]);
02701   free(seqVariables);
02702   
02703   // remove reference from dataset
02704   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(meshSlot->ds);
02705   if (dsSlot->numMesh == 1) {
02706     free(dsSlot->meshIDs);
02707     dsSlot->meshIDs = NULL;
02708     dsSlot->numMesh = 0;
02709   }
02710   else {
02711     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
02712       if (dsSlot->meshIDs[i] == meshSlot->header.slotID)
02713         break;
02714     }
02715     for (j = i+1; j < dsSlot->numMesh; j++) {
02716       dsSlot->meshIDs[j - 1] = dsSlot->meshIDs[j];
02717     }
02718     dsSlot->numMesh--;
02719   }
02720 
02721   // clear & delete slot
02722   return _fc_deleteMeshSlot(mesh);
02723 }
02724 
02725 //@}
02726 
02727 /** \name Get mesh metadata. */
02728 //-------------------------------
02729 //@{
02730 
02731 /**
02732  * \ingroup  Mesh
02733  * \brief Check that the handle refers to a valid mesh.
02734  *
02735  * \description
02736  *
02737  *    Returns 1 (true) is the handle is valid, and 0 (false) if it is not.
02738  *
02739  * \modifications  
02740  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
02741  */
02742 int fc_isMeshValid(
02743   FC_Mesh mesh  /**< input - mesh handle */
02744 ) {
02745   return _fc_isHandleValid(mesh.slotID, mesh.uID, meshTableSize,
02746                            (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable);
02747 }
02748 
02749 /**
02750  * \ingroup  Mesh
02751  * \brief  Return name of a mesh.
02752  *
02753  * \description
02754  *  
02755  *    Return the name associated with a mesh handle. Spaced
02756  *    is allocated for the string so it needs to be freed by the
02757  *    user when finished.
02758  *
02759  * \modifications  
02760  *     - Aug, 9, 2002.  W Koegler  Created.
02761  */
02762 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshName(
02763   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh handle */
02764   char **meshname       /**< output - mesh name, space allocated here
02765                              and must be freed by user when finished */
02766 ) {
02767   char *cp;
02768   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02769   
02770   // default
02771   if (meshname)
02772     *meshname = NULL;
02773   
02774   // check input
02775   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02776   if (meshSlot == NULL || meshname == NULL) {
02777     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02778     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02779   }
02780   
02781   // log message
02782   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting name for mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
02783 
02784   // copy name
02785   cp = meshSlot->header.name;
02786   *meshname = malloc(strlen(cp) + 1);
02787   if (*meshname == NULL) {
02788     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02789     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02790   }
02791   strcpy(*meshname, cp);
02792   
02793   return FC_SUCCESS;
02794 }
02795 
02796 /**
02797  * \ingroup  Mesh
02798  * \brief  Get the parent dataset of the mesh
02799  *
02800  * \modifications  
02801  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
02802  *    - 12/11/03 RM, added default return dataset = \ref FC_NULL_DATASET, 
02803  *            input check for dataset == NULL 
02804  */
02805 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetFromMesh(
02806   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh handle */
02807   FC_Dataset *dataset    /**< output - dataset handle */
02808 ) {
02809   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02810   
02811   // set up default value
02812   if(dataset != NULL)
02813     *dataset = FC_NULL_DATASET;
02814   
02815   // check input
02816   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02817   if (meshSlot == NULL || dataset == NULL) {
02818     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));    
02819     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02820   }
02821   
02822   // log message
02823   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting dataset from mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
02824   
02825   // return requested value
02826   *dataset = meshSlot->ds;
02827   
02828   return FC_SUCCESS;
02829 }
02830 
02831 /**
02832  * \ingroup  Mesh
02833  * \brief  Get information about a mesh.
02834  *
02835  * \description
02836  *
02837  *    Returns the topological dimensionality of the mesh elements, the
02838  *    spatial dimensionality of the mesh coordinates, the number of
02839  *    vertices, the number of elements, and the element type.
02840  *
02841  * \modifications  
02842  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
02843  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added checking for NULL mesh handle, 
02844  *         default return: topodim = -1, dim = -1, numVertex = -1;
02845  *         numElement = -1, elemType = \ref FC_ET_UNKNOWN; issue an error if 
02846  *         fc_getLibraryVerbosity().
02847  */
02848 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshInfo(
02849   FC_Mesh mesh,     /**< input - mesh handle */
02850   int *topodim,     /**< output - topological dimensionality of mesh (e.g. 0 
02851                             for a point mesh, 2 for a surface, 3 for volume) */
02852   int *dim,         /**< output - 2=2d coordinates, 3=3d coords */
02853   int *numVertex,   /**< output - number of vertices */
02854   int *numElement,  /**< output - number of elements */
02855   FC_ElementType *elemType    /**< output - element type (quad, tet) */
02856 ) {
02857   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02858   
02859   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02860   if (topodim != NULL) 
02861     *topodim = -1;   
02862   if (dim != NULL) 
02863     *dim = -1;
02864   if (numVertex != NULL) 
02865     *numVertex = -1;
02866   if (numElement != NULL)
02867     *numElement = -1;
02868   if (elemType != NULL) 
02869     *elemType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN; 
02870   
02871   // check input
02872   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02873   if (meshSlot == NULL || 
02874       (!topodim && !dim && !numVertex && !numElement && !elemType) ) {
02875      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02876     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02877   }
02878   
02879   // log message
02880   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting info for mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
02881 
02882   // fill in requested values
02883   if (dim != NULL)
02884     *dim = meshSlot->dim;
02885   if (topodim != NULL)
02886     *topodim = meshSlot->topodim;
02887   if (numVertex != NULL)
02888     *numVertex = meshSlot->numVertex;
02889   if (numElement != NULL)
02890     *numElement = meshSlot->numElement;
02891   if (elemType != NULL)
02892     *elemType = meshSlot->elemType;
02893   
02894   return FC_SUCCESS;
02895 }
02896 
02897 /**
02898  * \ingroup  Mesh
02899  * \brief  Returns the topological dimensionality of the mesh.
02900  *
02901  * \description
02902  *
02903  *    The topological dimensionality of the mesh is not the same
02904  *    as the dimensionality of the space it is embedded in. Instead the
02905  *    topological dimensionality is dependent on the element type where 
02906  *    point meshes are 0D, lines meshes are 1D, surface meshes like 
02907  *    triangles and quads are 2D, and volume meshes like tets, pyramids, 
02908  *    prisms and hexs are 3D. 
02909  *
02910  * \modifications  
02911  *     - Nancy Collins, Created.
02912  *     - 12/11/03 RM, added default return dim=-1, and input checking   
02913  */
02914 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshTopodim(
02915  FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh  */
02916  int *topodim    /**< output - topological dimensionality of elements */
02917 ) {
02918   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02919   
02920   // set up defaults 
02921   if (topodim != NULL)
02922     *topodim = -1; 
02923   
02924   // check input
02925   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02926   if (meshSlot == NULL || topodim == NULL) {
02927     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02928     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02929   }
02930   
02931   // log message
02932   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting topo dim for mesh '%s'", 
02933                       meshSlot->header.name);
02934 
02935   // fill in requested value
02936   *topodim = meshSlot->topodim;
02937   
02938   return FC_SUCCESS;
02939 }

03087 
03088 /**
03089  * \ingroup  Mesh
03090  * \brief  Get information about edges and faces in a mesh.
03091  *
03092  * \description
03093  *
03094  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
03095  *
03096  * \modifications  
03097  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
03098  */
03099 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo(
03100   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
03101   int *numEdge,   /**< output - number of edges */
03102   int *numFace,   /**< output - number of faces */
03103   FC_ElementType *faceType    /**< output - face type (tri, quad or mixed) */
03104 ) {
03105   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03106   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03107   
03108   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
03109   if (numEdge != NULL) 
03110     *numEdge = -1;
03111   if (numFace != NULL)
03112     *numFace = -1;
03113   if (faceType != NULL) 
03114     *faceType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN; 
03115   
03116   // check input
03117   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03118   if (meshSlot == NULL || (!numEdge && !numFace && !faceType) ) {
03119     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03120     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03121   }
03122   
03123   // log message
03124   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge and face info for mesh '%s'", 
03125                       meshSlot->header.name);
03126 
03127   // build edges & faces if necessary
03128   if (numEdge != NULL && meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03129     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03130     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03131       return rc;
03132   }
03133   if (numFace != NULL && meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03134     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03135     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03136       return rc;
03137   }
03138 
03139   // fill in requested values
03140   if (numEdge != NULL)
03141     *numEdge = meshSlot->numEdge;
03142   if (numFace != NULL)
03143     *numFace = meshSlot->numFace;
03144   if (faceType != NULL)
03145     *faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
03146   
03147   return FC_SUCCESS;
03148 }
03149 
03150 /**
03151  * \ingroup  Mesh
03152  * \brief  Get number of edges in a mesh.
03153  *
03154  * \description
03155  *
03156  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
03157  *
03158  * \modifications  
03159  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
03160  */
03161 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshNumEdge(
03162   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
03163   int *numEdge    /**< output - number of edges */
03164 ) {
03165   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03166   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03167   
03168   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
03169   if (numEdge != NULL) 
03170     *numEdge = -1;
03171   
03172   // check input
03173   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03174   if (meshSlot == NULL || !numEdge) {
03175     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03176     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03177   }
03178   
03179   // log message
03180   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting num edge for mesh '%s'", 
03181                       meshSlot->header.name);
03182 
03183   // build edges & faces if necessary
03184   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03185     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03186     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03187       return rc;
03188   }
03189 
03190   // fill in requested values
03191   if (numEdge != NULL)
03192     *numEdge = meshSlot->numEdge;
03193   
03194   return FC_SUCCESS;
03195 }
03196 
03197 /**
03198  * \ingroup  Mesh
03199  * \brief  Get number of faces in a mesh.
03200  *
03201  * \description
03202  *

03204  *

03222     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03223     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03224   }
03225   
03226   // log message
03227   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of faces for mesh '%s'", 
03228                       meshSlot->header.name);
03229 
03230   // build faces if necessary
03231   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03232     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03233     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03234       return rc;
03235   }

03243 
03244 /**
03245  * \ingroup  Mesh
03246  * \brief  Get element type of the face in the mesh.
03247  *
03248  * \description
03249  *
03250  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
03251  *    Pyramids and prisms may return the type FC_ET_MIXED.
03252  *
03253  * \modifications  
03254  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
03255  */
03256 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceType(
03257   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
03258   FC_ElementType *faceType    /**< output - face type (tri, quad or mixed) */
03259 ) {
03260   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03261   
03262   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
03263   if (faceType != NULL) 
03264     *faceType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN; 
03265   
03266   // check input
03267   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03268   if (meshSlot == NULL || !faceType) {
03269     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03270     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03271   }
03272   
03273   // log message
03274   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge and face info for mesh '%s'", 
03275                       meshSlot->header.name);
03276 
03277   // fill in requested values
03278   if (faceType != NULL)
03279     *faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
03280   
03281   return FC_SUCCESS;
03282 }
03283 
03284 /**
03285  * \ingroup  Mesh
03286  * \brief  Returns number of a type of mesh entity.
03287  *
03288  * \description
03289  *
03290  *    If you ask for edges or faces and they don't exist yet, they will
03291  *    be built.
03292  *
03293  *    It is an error to ask for the association type FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET.
03294  *
03295  * \modifications  
03296  *    - 06/07/04 RM, Created.
03297  *    - 07/16/04 WSK, Changed name.
03298  */
03299 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshNumEntity(
03300   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03301   FC_AssociationType assoc, /**< input - association type of entity */
03302   int *numEntity            /**< output - number of entities in the mesh */
03303 ) {
03304   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03305   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03306   // set up default return
03307   if (numEntity != NULL)
03308     *numEntity = -1;
03309     
03310   // check input
03311   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03312   if (meshSlot == NULL || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || 
03313       assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || numEntity == NULL) {
03314     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03315     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03316   }
03317 
03318   // log message
03319   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of entities of type %s for mesh '%s'", 
03320                       fc_getAssociationTypeText(assoc),
03321                       meshSlot->header.name);
03322 
03323   // get the number entities on the mesh for given assoc type
03324   // build edges & faces if necessary
03325   switch(assoc) {
03326   case FC_AT_VERTEX:   *numEntity = meshSlot->numVertex;   break;
03327   case FC_AT_EDGE:     
03328     if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03329       rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03330       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03331         return rc;
03332     }
03333     *numEntity = meshSlot->numEdge;     break;
03334   case FC_AT_FACE:     
03335     if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03336       rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03337       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03338         return rc;
03339     }
03340     *numEntity = meshSlot->numFace;     break; 
03341   case FC_AT_ELEMENT:  *numEntity = meshSlot->numElement;  break;
03342   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH:    *numEntity = 1;                     break;
03343   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:  // fall through to default
03344   default:
03345     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03346   }
03347   
03348   // should never reach here
03349   //fc_printfErrorMessage("Should never reach here");
03350   //return FC_ERROR;
03351   return FC_SUCCESS;
03352 }
03353 
03354 /**
03355  * \ingroup Mesh
03356  * \brief Get the element type of the mesh entity
03357  *
03358  * \description
03359  *
03360  *    This is really only interesting for faces and elements. The association
03361  *    type of "whole" returns the type of the elements of the mesh.
03362  *
03363  *    If you ask for edges or faces and they don't exist yet, they will
03364  *    be built.
03365  *
03366  *    It is an error to ask for the association type FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET.
03367  *
03368  * \modifications
03369  *    - 07/16/04 WSK Created.
03370  */
03371 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEntityElementType(
03372   FC_Mesh mesh,              /**< input - mesh */
03373   FC_AssociationType assoc,  /**< input - the entity's type */
03374   int ID,                    /**< input - the ID of the mesh entity */
03375   FC_ElementType* elemType   /**< output - the element type of the entity */
03376 ) {
03377   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03378   int num;
03379   FC_ElementType* faceTypes;
03380 
03381   // default return
03382   if (elemType)
03383     *elemType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
03384 
03385   // check input
03386   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || 
03387       assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || ID < 0 || !elemType)
03388     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03389   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, assoc, &num);
03390   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03391     return rc;
03392   if (ID >= num)
03393     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03394 
03395   switch (assoc) {
03396   case FC_AT_VERTEX: *elemType = FC_ET_POINT; break;
03397   case FC_AT_EDGE:   *elemType = FC_ET_LINE;  break;
03398   case FC_AT_FACE:
03399     fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(mesh, &faceTypes);
03400     *elemType = faceTypes[ID];
03401     break;
03402   case FC_AT_ELEMENT: // fall through to FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH
03403   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH: fc_getMeshElementType(mesh, elemType); break;
03404   case FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET: // fall through to FC_AT_UNKNOWN
03405   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:
03406     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03407   }
03408   
03409   return FC_SUCCESS;
03410 }
03411     
03412 //@}
03413 
03414 /** \name Get mesh big data. */
03415 //-------------------------------
03416 //@{
03417 
03418 /**
03419  * \ingroup  Mesh
03420  * \brief  Return the vertex coordinates of the mesh.
03421  *
03422  * \description
03423  *
03424  *    Return an array containing the values of each vertex location.  If the
03425  *    vertices are 2D, the array has X0, Y0, X1, Y1, etc - interleaved.  If the
03426  *    vertices are 3D, the array has X0, Y0, Z0, X1, Y1, Z1, ...  The user gets
03427  *    a pointer back to a shared array and should treat it as read only.  To
03428  *    modify any of the values the user must first make a copy.
03429  *
03430  *    Note, you can index to coordinate j of the ith vertex directly as
03431  *    coords[i*numDim + j];
03432  *
03433  * \modifications  
03434  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
03435  */
03436 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(
03437   FC_Mesh mesh,      /**< input - mesh */
03438   double **coords_p  /**< output - vertices. user should treat as read only */
03439 ) {
03440   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03441   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03442 
03443   // default return
03444   if (coords_p)
03445     *coords_p = NULL;
03446 
03447   // check input
03448   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03449   if (meshSlot == NULL || coords_p == NULL) {
03450     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03451     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03452   }
03453   
03454   // log message
03455   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coordinates for mesh '%s'", 
03456                       meshSlot->header.name);
03457 
03458 
03459   // lazy fetching of coords
03460   if (meshSlot->coords == NULL && meshSlot->header.committed == 1) {
03461     rc = _fc_readMeshCoords(mesh);
03462     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03463       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of coords for mesh '%s' failed",
03464                             meshSlot->header.name);
03465       return rc;
03466     }
03467   }
03468 
03469   // fill in requested value
03470   *coords_p = meshSlot->coords;
03471   
03472   return FC_SUCCESS;
03473 }
03474 
03475 /**
03476  * \ingroup  Mesh
03477  * \brief  Return the vertex coordinates of the mesh as a variable.
03478  *
03479  * \description
03480  * 
03481  *    Returns the variable which is the coords of the mesh, creating it on 
03482  *    the first call to this function (and returning the same handle on
03483  *    successive calls). The name of the variable will be 'coordinates'.
03484  *
03485  *    The official coords variable is treated a little differently from regular
03486  *    variables.  Calling this routine always provides a handle to the same
03487  *    variable.  However, making a copy gives back a normal variable with the
03488  *    same data (it's not an official coords variable).
03489  *
03490  *    This variable will not be written to disk when the dataset containing
03491  *    it is written to disk. If a copy of a mesh with a coords variable 
03492  *    is made, the copied mesh will have an existing coords variable.
03493  *
03494  * \modifications  
03495  *    - 09/15/04 WSK, Created.
03496  */
03497 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshCoordsAsVariable(
03498   FC_Mesh mesh,      /**< input - mesh */
03499   FC_Variable *coords_var /**< output - variable containing coords */
03500 ) {
03501   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03502   FC_MathType mathType;
03503   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03504   double* coords_p;
03505 
03506   // default return
03507   if (coords_var)
03508     *coords_var = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03509 
03510   // check input
03511   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03512   if (meshSlot == NULL || coords_var == NULL) {
03513     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03514     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03515   }
03516   
03517   // log message
03518   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating coordinates variable for mesh '%s'", 
03519                       meshSlot->header.name);
03520 
03521   // If the coords variable already exists, return it
03522   if (meshSlot->coordVarID > -1) {
03523     _FC_GET_HANDLE(*coords_var, _fc_getVarSlotFromID(meshSlot->coordVarID));
03524     return FC_SUCCESS;
03525   }
03526 
03527   // create the variable
03528   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
03529   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03530     return rc;
03531   if (meshSlot->dim == 1)
03532     mathType = FC_MT_SCALAR;
03533   else
03534     mathType = FC_MT_VECTOR;
03535   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "coords", coords_var);
03536   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03537     return rc;
03538   rc = fc_setVariableData(*coords_var, meshSlot->numVertex, meshSlot->dim,
03539                           FC_AT_VERTEX, mathType, FC_DT_DOUBLE,
03540                           (void*)coords_p);
03541   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03542     return FC_ERROR;
03543 
03544   // set the coord var
03545   meshSlot->coordVarID = coords_var->slotID;
03546   
03547   return FC_SUCCESS;
03548 }
03549 
03550 /**
03551  * \ingroup  Mesh
03552  * \brief  Return edge connectivities
03553  *
03554  * \description
03555  *  
03556  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that
03557  *    has the IDs of the vertices that make up the edges. The array
03558  *    is { Edge0Vert0 Edge0Vert1 Edge1Vert0 Edge1Vert1 ... EdgeNVert0 EdgeNVert1 }.
03559  *    This is a big data array and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03560  *
03561  *    You can index to the jth vertex of the ith edge directly as conns[i*2 + j];
03562  *
03563  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03564  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03565  *
03566  * \modifications
03567  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, created.
03568  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, removed args for non-big data values which can
03569  *      now be gotten with fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo().
03570  */
03571 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(
03572   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03573   int **conns_p    /**< output - edge to vertex connections, treat read only */
03574 ) {
03575   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03576   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03577   
03578   // default return
03579   if (conns_p)
03580     *conns_p = NULL;
03581 
03582   // check input
03583   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03584   if (meshSlot == NULL || conns_p == NULL) {
03585     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03586     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03587   }
03588   
03589   // log message
03590   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03591                       meshSlot->header.name);
03592 
03593   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03594   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03595     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03596     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03597       return rc;
03598   }
03599 
03600   // return pointer
03601   *conns_p = meshSlot->edgeToVertConns;
03602   
03603   return FC_SUCCESS;
03604 }
03605 
03606 /**
03607  * \ingroup  Mesh
03608  * \brief  Return face types
03609  *
03610  * \description
03611  *
03612  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that
03613  *    has the element type of each face.
03614  *    This is a big data array and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03615  *
03616  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03617  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03618  *
03619  * \modifications
03620  *    - 10/25/05 WSD, created.
03621  */
03622 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(
03623   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03624   FC_ElementType **faceTypes_p    /**< output - face types, treat read only */
03625 ) {
03626   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03627   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03628   
03629   // default return
03630   if (faceTypes_p)
03631     *faceTypes_p = NULL;
03632 
03633   // check input
03634   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03635   if (meshSlot == NULL || faceTypes_p == NULL) {
03636     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03637     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03638   }
03639   
03640   // log message
03641   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03642                       meshSlot->header.name);
03643 
03644   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03645   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03646     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03647     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03648       return rc;
03649   }
03650 
03651   // return pointer
03652   *faceTypes_p = meshSlot->faceTypes;
03653   
03654   return FC_SUCCESS;
03655 }
03656 
03657 /**
03658  * \ingroup  Mesh
03659  * \brief  Return face connectivities
03660  *
03661  * \description  
03662  *
03663  *    This routine returns an array that has the IDs of the vertices that make
03664  *    up the faces. In addition there is an array with the number of vertices
03665  *    per face because some element types have multiple types of faces
03666  *    (i.e. pyramids and prisms).  For example, if the faces are triangles,
03667  *    every entry of the numVertPerFace array will be '3' and the connectivity
03668  *    array will look like { Face0Vert0 Face0Vert1 Face0Vert2 Face1Vert0
03669  *    ... FaceNVert0 FaceNVert1 FaceNVert2 }. 
03670  *
03671  *    If the face type is mixed, the connectivity array will be
03672  *    maxNumVertPerFace * numFace long and the unused entries (for when
03673  *    numVertPerFace < maxNumVertPerFace) will be equal to -1.  For example, a
03674  *    prism mesh's face connectivity might have numVertPerFace = { 3 4 3 ... }
03675  *    and conns = { Face0Vert0 Face0Vert1 Face0Vert2 -1 Face1Vert0 Face1Vert1
03676  *    Face1Vert2 Face1Vert3 Face2Vert0 Face2Vert1 Face2Vert2 -1 ... }.
03677  *    Note you can index directly to face n by conns[n*maxNumVertPerFace].
03678  *
03679  *    The number of vertices per face and the connectivity arrays are both
03680  *    considered to big data arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling
03681  *    program. Fetching the numVertPerFaceArray is optional.
03682  * 
03683  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03684  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03685  *
03686  * \modifications
03687  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, created.
03688  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, removed args for non-big data values which can
03689  *      now be gotten with fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo().
03690  */
03691 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(
03692   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh */
03693   int** numVertPerFace_p,  /**< output -  (optional) num vert per face, 
03694                               treat read only */
03695   int* maxNumVertPerFace_p,  /**< output - (optional) stride length of the
03696                               conns array */ 
03697   int **conns_p   /**< output - face to vertex connections, treat read only */
03698 ) {
03699   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03700   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03701   
03702   // default return
03703   if (numVertPerFace_p)
03704     *numVertPerFace_p = NULL;
03705   if (maxNumVertPerFace_p)
03706     *maxNumVertPerFace_p = -1;
03707   if (conns_p)
03708     *conns_p = NULL;
03709 
03710   // check input
03711   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03712   if (meshSlot == NULL || !conns_p) {
03713     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03714     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03715   }
03716   
03717   // log message
03718   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting face connectivities for mesh '%s'", 
03719                       meshSlot->header.name);
03720 
03721   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03722   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03723     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03724     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03725       return rc;
03726   }
03727 
03728   // return values
03729   if (numVertPerFace_p)
03730     *numVertPerFace_p = meshSlot->numVertPerFace;
03731   if (maxNumVertPerFace_p) {
03732     FC_ElementType faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
03733     if (faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
03734       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = 4; // assume will be mix of tris and quads
03735     else if (faceType == FC_ET_UNKNOWN)
03736       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = 0;
03737     else
03738       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = meshSlot->numVertPerFace[0];
03739   } 
03740   *conns_p = meshSlot->faceToVertConns;
03741   
03742   return FC_SUCCESS;
03743 }
03744 
03745 /**
03746  * \ingroup  Mesh
03747  * \brief  Return element to vertex connectivities for the mesh
03748  *
03749  * \description
03750  *
03751  *    Return actual element indices.  The return value is a pointer to an array
03752  *    of integers.  The user must treat this array as read only.  To modify any
03753  *    values, the user must make a copy first.  If each element contains N
03754  *    vertices, the first N integers are for element 0, the next N integers are
03755  *    element 1, etc. To get the jth vertex ID of the ith element index
03756  *    as conns[i*numVertPrElem + j]. numVertPerElem can be find by calling
03757  *    fc_getElementTypeNumVertex() or fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
03758  *
03759  * \modifications  
03760  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
03761  */
03762 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(
03763   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh */
03764   int **conns_p   /**< output - element index buffer, treat read only */
03765 ) {
03766   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03767   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03768   
03769   // default return
03770   if (conns_p)
03771     *conns_p = NULL;
03772 
03773   // check input
03774   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03775   if (meshSlot == NULL || conns_p == NULL) {
03776     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03777     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03778   }
03779   
03780   // log message
03781   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element connectivities for mesh '%s'", 
03782                       meshSlot->header.name);
03783 
03784   // lazy fetching of conns
03785   if (meshSlot->elemToVertConns == NULL && meshSlot->header.committed == 1) {
03786     rc = _fc_readMeshElemConns(mesh);
03787     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03788       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of conns for mesh '%s' failed",
03789                             meshSlot->header.name);
03790       return rc;
03791     }
03792   }
03793 
03794   // fill in requested value
03795   *conns_p = meshSlot->elemToVertConns;
03796   
03797   return FC_SUCCESS;
03798 }
03799 
03800 /**
03801  * \ingroup  Mesh
03802  * \brief  Return element to edge connectivities.
03803  *
03804  * \description
03805  *
03806  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has the IDs of the edges
03807  *    that make up the elements. The array is { Elem0Edge0 Elem0Edge1
03808  *    ... Elem0EdgeN Elem1Edge0 Elem1Edge1 ... Elem1EdgeN ...... ElemMEdge0
03809  *    ElemMEdge1 ... ElemMEdgeN }.  This is a big data array and should NOT be
03810  *    freed by the calling program. To get the id of the jth edge in the ith
03811  *    element, index by conns[i*numEdgePerElem+j]. numEdgePerElem can be
03812  *    found by a call to fc_getElementTypeNumEdge() or
03813  *    fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
03814  *
03815  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03816  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03817  *
03818  * \modifications
03819  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03820  */
03821 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(
03822   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03823   int **elemToEdgeConns_p   /**< output - element to edge connections, 
03824                                treat read only */
03825 ) {
03826   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03827   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03828   
03829   // default return
03830   if (elemToEdgeConns_p)
03831     *elemToEdgeConns_p = NULL;
03832 
03833   // check input
03834   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03835   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemToEdgeConns_p == NULL) {
03836     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03837     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03838   }
03839   
03840   // log message
03841   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03842                       meshSlot->header.name);
03843 
03844   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03845   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03846     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03847     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03848       return rc;
03849   }
03850 
03851   // return pointer
03852   *elemToEdgeConns_p = meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns;
03853   
03854   return FC_SUCCESS;
03855 }
03856 
03857 /**
03858  * \ingroup  Mesh
03859  * \brief  Return element to face connectivities.
03860  *
03861  * \description
03862  *
03863  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has the IDs of the faces
03864  *    that make up the elements. The array is { Elem0Face0 Elem0Face1
03865  *    ... Elem0FaceN Elem1Face0 Elem1Face1 ... Elem1FaceN ...... ElemMFace0
03866  *    ElemMFace1 ... ElemMFaceN }.  This is a big data array and should NOT be
03867  *    freed by the calling program. To get the id of the jth face in the ith
03868  *    element, index by conns[i*numFacePerElem+j]. numFacePerElem can be
03869  *    found by a call to fc_getElementTypeNumFace() or
03870  *    fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
03871  *
03872  *    See also fc_getMeshElementFaceOrientsPtr().
03873  *
03874  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03875  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03876  *
03877  * \modifications
03878  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03879  */
03880 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(
03881   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03882   int **elemToFaceConns_p   /**< output - element to face connections, 
03883                                treat read only */
03884 ) {
03885   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03886   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03887   
03888   // default return
03889   if (elemToFaceConns_p)
03890     *elemToFaceConns_p = NULL;
03891 
03892   // check input
03893   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03894   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemToFaceConns_p == NULL) {
03895     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03896     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03897   }
03898   
03899   // log message
03900   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to face connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03901                       meshSlot->header.name);
03902 
03903   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03904   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03905     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03906     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03907       return rc;
03908   }
03909 
03910   // return pointer
03911   *elemToFaceConns_p = meshSlot->elemToFaceConns;
03912   
03913   return FC_SUCCESS;
03914 }
03915 
03916 /**
03917  * \ingroup  Mesh
03918  * \brief  Return element's face's orientations relative to global faces.
03919  *
03920  * \description
03921  *
03922  *    By definition, the vertices of the faces of an element are ordered
03923  *    (counter clockwise) so that the face's normal points out of the element.
03924  *    In the gobal face array for a mesh, however, the vertices are (somewhat)
03925  *    arbitrarily ordered and you cannot know for sure the direction of
03926  *    a face without reference to an element. For example, a face shared by
03927  *    two elements has a different orientation depending on which element
03928  *    you are talking about. Let's say that the face was defined so that
03929  *    it points out of the first element. Then the entry of the faceOrients
03930  *    array for that face of the first element is 1. The faceOrients value
03931  *    for that face in the second element is -1. The -1 tells you that you
03932  *    need to reverse the order of the vertices of that face in order to
03933  *    treat it as if it had come from the second element. 
03934  *
03935  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has orientation flags
03936  *    for the faces that make up the elements. The array is ordered {
03937  *    Elem0Face0 Elem0Face1 ... Elem0FaceN Elem1Face0 Elem1Face1 ... Elem1FaceN
03938  *    ...... ElemMFace0 ElemMFace1 ... ElemMFaceN }.  This is a big data array
03939  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program. Possible values are 1:
03940  *    vertices of the face are in order expected for the element; or -1:
03941  *    vertices of the face are in the reverse order of that expected for the
03942  *    element. 
03943  *
03944  *    (I'm pretty sure that all unique faces will have orient = 1.)
03945  *
03946  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03947  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03948  *
03949  * \modifications
03950  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03951  */
03952 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementFaceOrientsPtr(
03953   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03954   int **elemFaceOrients_p   /**< output - element's face's orientations, 
03955                                treat read only */
03956 ) {
03957   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03958   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03959   
03960   // default return
03961   if (elemFaceOrients_p)
03962     *elemFaceOrients_p = NULL;
03963 
03964   // check input
03965   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03966   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemFaceOrients_p == NULL) {
03967     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03968     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03969   }
03970   
03971   // log message
03972   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to face connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03973                       meshSlot->header.name);
03974 
03975   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03976   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03977     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03978     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03979       return rc;
03980   }
03981 
03982   // return pointer
03983   *elemFaceOrients_p = meshSlot->elemFaceOrients;
03984   
03985   return FC_SUCCESS;
03986 }
03987 
03988 //@}
03989 
03990 /** \name Print mesh. */
03991 //-------------------------------
03992 //@{
03993 
03994 /**
03995  * \ingroup  Mesh
03996  * \brief Print mesh meta data to stdout, and optionally the connections
03997  *        and/or coordinates.
03998  *
03999  * \modifications 
04000  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
04001  *    - 10/31/07 ACG optional precision
04002  *    - 03/03/08 ACG seq subset
04003  */
04004 FC_ReturnCode fc_printMesh(
04005   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh */
04006   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
04007                                      can be NULL */
04008   int print_edgeConns,  /**< input > 0  = print the edge connectivities. */
04009   int print_faceConns,  /**< input > 0 = print the face connectivities. */
04010   int print_elemConns,  /**< input > 0 = print the element connectivities. */
04011   int print_coords      /**< input - 1 = print the coordinates too
04012                   2 = print the coordinates in exponential notation w 5 digits precision */
04013 
04014 ) {
04015   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04016   int i, j;
04017   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04018   int topodim, dim, numVertex, numElement, numSubset, numSeqSubset, numVar, numSeqVar;
04019   int numEdge, numFace;
04020   FC_ElementType elemType, faceType;
04021   int* ebuf, *numVertPerFace, maxNum;
04022   double* vbuf;
04023 
04024   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
04025   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, FC_NULL_MESH)) {
04026     printf("Mesh: FC_NULL_MESH\n");
04027     fflush(NULL);
04028     return FC_SUCCESS;
04029   }
04030 
04031   // check input
04032   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04033   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
04034     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04035     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04036   }
04037 
04038   // log message
04039   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
04040 
04041   // print label & var name
04042   if (label)
04043     printf("%s: ", label);
04044   else
04045     printf("Mesh: ");
04046   printf("'%s'\n", meshSlot->header.name);
04047   fflush(NULL);
04048 
04049   // print meta data
04050   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh,  &topodim, &dim, &numVertex, &numElement,
04051                       &elemType);
04052   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04053     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for mesh '%s'",
04054                           meshSlot->header.name);
04055     return rc;
04056   }
04057   rc = fc_getNumSubset(mesh, &numSubset);
04058   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04059     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get subsets for mesh '%s'",
04060                           meshSlot->header.name);
04061     return rc;
04062   }
04063   rc = fc_getNumSeqSubset(mesh, &numSeqSubset);
04064   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04065     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get seq subsets for mesh '%s'",
04066                           meshSlot->header.name);
04067     return rc;
04068   }
04069   rc = fc_getNumVariable(mesh, &numVar);
04070   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04071     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get variables for mesh '%s'",
04072                           meshSlot->header.name);
04073     return rc;
04074   }
04075   rc = fc_getNumSeqVariable(mesh, &numSeqVar);
04076   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04077     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get seq variables for mesh '%s'",
04078                           meshSlot->header.name);
04079     return rc;
04080   }
04081   printf("%snumVertex = %d, dim = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numVertex, dim);
04082   printf("%snumElement = %d, topodim = %d, elemType = %s\n", INDENT_STR,
04083          numElement, topodim, fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
04084   printf("%snumSubset = %d, numSeqSubset = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numSubset, numSeqSubset);
04085   printf("%snumVar = %d, numSeqVar = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numVar, numSeqVar);
04086   fflush(NULL);
04087   
04088   // print edge connectivities
04089   if (print_edgeConns > 0) {
04090     if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0) {
04091       printf("%sEdges have not been built for this mesh\n", INDENT_STR);
04092       fflush(NULL);
04093     }
04094     else {
04095       rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
04096       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04097         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get numEdge for mesh '%s'",
04098                                meshSlot->header.name);
04099         return rc;
04100       }
04101       rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &ebuf);
04102       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04103         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge conns for mesh '%s'",
04104                               meshSlot->header.name);
04105         return rc;
04106       }
04107       
04108       // print the conns
04109       printf("%sEdge connectivities (2 vertices per edge):\n", INDENT_STR);
04110       for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) {
04111         printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
04112         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
04113           printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*2 + j]);
04114           fflush(NULL);
04115         }
04116         printf("\n");
04117         fflush(NULL);
04118       }
04119     }
04120   }
04121   
04122   // print face connectivities
04123   if (print_faceConns > 0) {
04124     if (meshSlot->numFace < 0) {
04125       printf("%sFaces have not been built for this mesh\n", INDENT_STR);
04126       fflush(NULL);
04127     }
04128     else {
04129       rc = fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo(mesh, NULL, &numFace, &faceType);
04130       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04131         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge/face info for mesh '%s'",
04132                               meshSlot->header.name);
04133         return rc;
04134       }
04135       rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFace, &maxNum, &ebuf);
04136       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04137         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge conns for mesh '%s'",
04138                               meshSlot->header.name);
04139         return rc;
04140       }
04141       
04142       // print the conns
04143       if (faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
04144         printf("%sFace connectivities (faceType = %s, 3 or 4 vertices per "
04145                "element):\n", INDENT_STR, fc_getElementTypeText(faceType));
04146       else
04147         printf("%sFace connectivities (faceType = %s, %d vertices per "
04148                "element):\n", INDENT_STR, fc_getElementTypeText(faceType), 
04149                fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceType));
04150       fflush(NULL);
04151       for (i = 0; i < numFace; i++) {
04152         printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
04153         for (j = 0; j < numVertPerFace[i]; j++) { 
04154           printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*maxNum+j]);
04155           fflush(NULL);
04156         }
04157         printf("\n");
04158         fflush(NULL);
04159       }
04160     }
04161   }
04162   
04163   // print element connectivities
04164   if (print_elemConns > 0) {
04165     int numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
04166     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &ebuf);
04167     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04168       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get element conns for mesh '%s'",
04169                             meshSlot->header.name);
04170       return FC_ERROR;
04171     }
04172     
04173     // print the conns
04174     printf("%sElement connectivities (%d vertices per element):\n", 
04175            INDENT_STR, numVertPerElem);
04176     fflush(NULL);
04177     for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
04178       printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
04179       for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++) {
04180         printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*numVertPerElem + j]);
04181         fflush(NULL);
04182       }
04183       printf("\n");
04184       fflush(NULL);
04185     }
04186   }
04187   
04188   // print coords
04189   if (print_coords > 0) {
04190     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &vbuf);
04191     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04192       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for mesh '%s'",
04193                             meshSlot->header.name);
04194       return FC_ERROR;
04195     }
04196     
04197     // print the coordinates per vertex
04198     printf("%sVertex Coordinates:\n", INDENT_STR);
04199     fflush(NULL);
04200     for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
04201       printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
04202       for (j = 0; j < dim; j++) {
04203         // see comment on precision in for DOUBLE case in fc_printVariable()
04204         //printf("%20.15g ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
04205      switch (print_coords){
04206      case 2:
04207        printf("%5le ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
04208        break;
04209      default:
04210        printf("%16.11g ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
04211        break;
04212      }
04213         fflush(NULL);
04214       }
04215       printf("\n");
04216       fflush(NULL);
04217     }
04218   }
04219   
04220   return FC_SUCCESS;
04221 }
04222 
04223 //@}
04224 
04225 /**
04226  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04227  * \brief  Return parent edges of the vertices.
04228  *
04229  * \description
04230  *
04231  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
04232  *    parent edges for each vertex and the IDs of the parent edges for
04233  *    each vertex. The array with the edge IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
04234  *    edge parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an edge parent ID by
04235  *
04236  *    edgeParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
04237  *
04238  *    where i is 0 ... numEdgePerVert[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays
04239  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
04240  *
04241  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
04242  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
04243  *   
04244  *    Also note that if there cannot be any edges on the mesh (only happens
04245  *    for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
04246  *
04247  * \modifications
04248  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
04249  */
04250 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshEdgeParentsOfVerticesPtr(
04251   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
04252   int** numEdgePerVert,     /**< output - array of number of edge parents per
04253                                vertex */
04254   int*** edgeParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of edge parent IDs, 
04255                                treat read only */
04256 ) {
04257   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04258   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04259   
04260   // default return
04261   if (numEdgePerVert)
04262     *numEdgePerVert = NULL;
04263   if (edgeParentsPerVert)
04264     *edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
04265 
04266   // check input
04267   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04268   if (meshSlot == NULL || numEdgePerVert == NULL ||
04269       edgeParentsPerVert == NULL) {
04270     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04271     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04272   }
04273   
04274   // log message
04275   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent edges of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
04276                       meshSlot->header.name);
04277 
04278   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04279   if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0 || 
04280       (meshSlot->numEdge > 0 && meshSlot->numEdgePerVert == NULL)) {
04281     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_EDGE);
04282     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04283       return rc;
04284   }
04285 
04286   // return pointers
04287   *numEdgePerVert = meshSlot->numEdgePerVert;
04288   *edgeParentsPerVert = meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert;
04289   
04290   return FC_SUCCESS;
04291 }
04292 
04293 /**
04294  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04295  * \brief  Return parent faces of the vertices.
04296  *
04297  * \description
04298  *
04299  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
04300  *    parent faces for each vertex and the IDs of the parent faces for
04301  *    each vertex. The array with the face IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
04302  *    face parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an face parent ID by
04303  *
04304  *    faceParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
04305  *
04306  *    where i is 0 ... numFacePerVert[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays
04307  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
04308  *
04309  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
04310  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
04311  *
04312  *    Also note that if there cannot be any faces on the mesh (only happens
04313  *    for point and line meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
04314  *
04315  * \modifications
04316  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
04317  */
04318 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshFaceParentsOfVerticesPtr(
04319   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
04320   int** numFacePerVert,     /**< output - array of number of face parents per
04321                                vertex */
04322   int*** faceParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of face parent IDs, 
04323                                treat read only */
04324 ) {
04325   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04326   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04327   
04328   // default return
04329   if (numFacePerVert)
04330     *numFacePerVert = NULL;
04331   if (faceParentsPerVert)
04332     *faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
04333 
04334   // check input
04335   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04336   if (meshSlot == NULL || numFacePerVert == NULL ||
04337       faceParentsPerVert == NULL) {
04338     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04339     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04340   }
04341   
04342   // log message
04343   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent faces of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
04344                       meshSlot->header.name);
04345 
04346   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04347   if (meshSlot->numFace < 0 || 
04348       (meshSlot->numFace > 0 && meshSlot->numFacePerVert == NULL)) {
04349     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_FACE);
04350     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04351       return rc;
04352   }
04353 
04354   // return pointers
04355   *numFacePerVert = meshSlot->numFacePerVert;
04356   *faceParentsPerVert = meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert;
04357   
04358   return FC_SUCCESS;
04359 }

04361 /**
04362  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04363  * \brief  Return parent elements of the vertices.
04364  *
04365  * \description
04366  *
04367  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
04368  *    parent elements for each vertex and the IDs of the parent elements for
04369  *    each vertex. The array with the element IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
04370  *    element parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an element parent ID by
04371  *
04372  *    elemParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
04373  *
04374  *    where i is 0 ... numElemPerVert[vertID] - 1. These are a big data arrays and
04375  *    should NOT be freed by the calling program.
04376  *
04377  * \modifications
04378  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
04379  */
04380 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfVerticesPtr(
04381   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
04382   int** numElemPerVert,     /**< output - array of number of elem parents per
04383                                vertex */
04384   int*** elemParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of elem parent IDs, 
04385                                treat read only */
04386 ) {
04387   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04388   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04389   
04390   // default return
04391   if (numElemPerVert)
04392     *numElemPerVert = NULL;
04393   if (elemParentsPerVert)
04394     *elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
04395 
04396   // check input
04397   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04398   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemPerVert == NULL ||
04399       elemParentsPerVert == NULL) {
04400     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04401     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04402   }
04403   
04404   // log message
04405   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
04406                       meshSlot->header.name);
04407 
04408   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04409   if (!meshSlot->numElemPerVert) {
04410     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_ELEMENT);
04411     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04412       return rc;
04413   }
04414 
04415   // return pointers

04417   *elemParentsPerVert = meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert;
04418   
04419   return FC_SUCCESS;

04569  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).

04572  *    for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.

04578   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
04579   int** numVertNeighsViaEdge,  /**< output - array of number of vert
