04776   int** numElemNeighsViaFace,  /**< output - array of number of elem 
04777                                 neighbors per elem (that share an face)*/
04778   int*** elemNeighsViaFace  /**< output - array of arrays of elem neighbor
04779                                IDs, treat read only */
04780 ) {
04781   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04782   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04783   
04784   // default return
04785   if (numElemNeighsViaFace)
04786     *numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
04787   if (elemNeighsViaFace)
04788     *elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
04789 
04790   // check input
04791   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04792   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemNeighsViaFace == NULL ||
04793       elemNeighsViaFace == NULL) {
04794     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04795     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04796   }
04797   
04798   // log message
04799   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the faces on mesh '%s'", 
04800                       meshSlot->header.name);
04801 
04802   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04803   if (meshSlot->numFace < 0 || 
04804       (meshSlot->numFace > 0 && meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace == NULL)) {
04805     rc = _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(mesh, FC_AT_FACE);
04806     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04807       return rc;
04808   }
04809 
04810   // return pointers
04811   *numElemNeighsViaFace = meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace;
04812   *elemNeighsViaFace = meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace;
04813   
04814   return FC_SUCCESS;
04815 }
04816 
04817 /**
04818  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04819  * \brief Build an arrays of parent IDs.
04820  *
04821  * \description
04822  *
04823  *     Build arrays that hold the parent IDs for the requested child/parent
04824  *     combination.
04825  *              
04826  * \modifications  
04827  *      - 11/01/2005 WSD. Creatd to replace building parents lists
04828  *      in _fc_buildElements(), _fc_buildEdges, & _fc_buildFaces.
04829  */
04830 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildParents(
04831   FC_Mesh mesh,                  /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04832   FC_AssociationType childType,  /**< Child entity type. */
04833   FC_AssociationType parentType  /**< Parent entity type. */
04834 ) {
04835   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04836   int i, j;
04837   int numChild, numParent, *parentToChildConns, *numVertPerFace = NULL;
04838   int numChildPerParent, maxNumChildPerParent;
04839   int *numParentPerChild, **parentsPerChild;
04840    _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
04841    FC_ElementType elemType;
04842    FC_SortedIntArray* lists; // a list of parent IDs
04843   
04844   // check inputs
04845   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(childType) ||
04846       childType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || childType == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH ||
04847       !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(parentType) || parentType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || 
04848       parentType == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
04849     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04850     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04851   }
04852   if (childType >= parentType) {
04853     fc_printfErrorMessage("child type must be child of parent type");
04854     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04855   }
04856   
04857   // Setup I
04858   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, parentType, &numParent);
04859   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04860     return rc;
04861 
04862   // Special case, if the parent type doesn't exist, then we're done
04863   if (numParent == 0) 
04864     return FC_SUCCESS;
04865 
04866   // log message
04867   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04868   fc_printfLogMessage("Building vertex neighbors via edge on mesh '%s'", 
04869                       meshSlot->header.name);
04870 
04871   // Setup II
04872   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, childType, &numChild);
04873   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04874     return rc;
04875 
04876    rc = fc_getMeshEntityElementType(mesh, parentType, 0, &elemType);
04877   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04878     return rc;
04879  // this # gets overwritten or vert-face case
04880   maxNumChildPerParent = fc_getElementTypeNumEntity(elemType, childType);
04881   // do entity specific stuff - conns
04882   if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_EDGE) 
04883     rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04884   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_FACE) 
04885     rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFace, &maxNumChildPerParent,
04886                                 &parentToChildConns);
04887   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04888     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04889   // child = edge, parent = face not supported
04890   else if (childType == FC_AT_EDGE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04891     rc = fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04892   else if (childType == FC_AT_FACE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04893     rc = fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04894   else {
04895     fc_printfErrorMessage("The combination: child = %s, parent = %s is "
04896                           "not supported",
04897                           fc_getAssociationTypeText(childType), 
04898                           fc_getAssociationTypeText(parentType));
04899     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04900   }
04901   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04902     return rc;
04903   lists = malloc(numChild*sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
04904   if (lists == NULL) {
04905     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04906     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04907   }
04908   for (i = 0; i < numChild; i++)
04909     fc_initSortedIntArray(&lists[i]);
04910 
04911   // for each Parent
04912   for (i = 0; i < numParent; i++) {
04913     if (numVertPerFace)
04914       numChildPerParent = numVertPerFace[i];
04915     else
04916       numChildPerParent = maxNumChildPerParent;
04917     // get parent's children & add parent ID to those children's lists
04918     for (j = 0; j < numChildPerParent; j++) {
04919       int ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&(lists[parentToChildConns[i*maxNumChildPerParent+j]]),
04920                    i);
04921       if (ret < 0) {
04922         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
04923         return ret;
04924       }    
04925     }
04926   }
04927 
04928   // convert lists to arrays
04929   numParentPerChild = (int*)malloc(numChild*sizeof(int));
04930   parentsPerChild = (int**)calloc(numChild, sizeof(int*));
04931   if (numParentPerChild == NULL || parentsPerChild == NULL) {
04932     free(numParentPerChild);
04933     free(parentsPerChild);
04934     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04935     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04936   }
04937   for (i = 0; i < numChild; i++) {
04938     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&(lists[i]), &(numParentPerChild[i]),
04939                                 &(parentsPerChild[i]));
04940     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04941       return rc;
04942   }
04943 
04944   // cleanup 
04945   free(lists);
04946 
04947   // set results on mesh
04948   if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_EDGE) {
04949     meshSlot->numEdgePerVert = numParentPerChild;
04950     meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04951   }
04952   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_FACE) {
04953     meshSlot->numFacePerVert = numParentPerChild;
04954     meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04955   }
04956   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04957     meshSlot->numElemPerVert = numParentPerChild;
04958     meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04959   }
04960   else if (childType == FC_AT_EDGE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04961     meshSlot->numElemPerEdge = numParentPerChild;
04962     meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge = parentsPerChild;
04963   }
04964   else if (childType == FC_AT_FACE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04965     meshSlot->numElemPerFace = numParentPerChild;
04966     meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace = parentsPerChild;
04967   }
04968 
04969   return FC_SUCCESS;
04970 }
04971 
04972 /**
04973  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
04974  * \brief Special data blob for sorting edges
04975  *
04976  * \description
04977  *
04978  *    Used only in _fc_buildEdges().
04979  */
04980 typedef struct {
04981   int endVert;
04982   int edgeID;
04983 } _EdgeBlob;
04984  
04985 /**
04986  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04987  * \brief Build the edge info for the mesh
04988  *
04989  * \description
04990  *  
04991  *    Finds the unique list of edges for the given set of elements.
04992  *    It also adds edgeIDs arrays to each element.
04993  *
04994  *    Assumes that all elements are the same type.
04995  *
04996  * \modifications   
04997  *    - Wendy Koegler 4/02  Created
04998  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
04999  *    - 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections
05000  *      to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
05001  */
05002 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildEdgeConns(
05003   FC_Mesh mesh              /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
05004 ) {
05005   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05006   int i, j, k;
05007   int numVertex, numElement, *elemConns;
05008   int numVertPerElem, numEdgePerElem, numEdge;
05009   int temp_ID;
05010   int *edgeConns, *elemToEdgeConns;
05011   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
05012   FC_ElementType elemType;
05013   typedef int VertexIDPair[2];
05014   VertexIDPair vertexIDs;
05015   VertexIDPair* map; // map element's vertices to it's edges vertices
05016   // for 2D or less, edges are traversed in similar order to vertices
05017   // for 3D, edges traversed in order of faces, then faces edges (of course,
05018   // ignoring edges already traversed) -- see fc_buildFaces for face order.
05019   VertexIDPair lineMap[1] =    { { 0, 1 } };
05020   VertexIDPair triMap[3] =     { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 2 }, { 2, 0 } };
05021   VertexIDPair quadMap[4] =    { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 2 }, { 2, 3 }, { 3, 0 } };
05022   // tetMap: 3 from 1st face, 2 from 2nd face, 1 from 3rd face, 0 from base
05023   VertexIDPair tetMap[6] =     { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 3 }, { 3, 0 }, 
05024                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 3 }, 
05025                                  { 2, 0 } };
05026   // pyramidMap: 3 from 1st face, 2 from 2nd &3rd faces, 1 from 4th, 0 base
05027   VertexIDPair pyramidMap[8] = { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 4 }, { 4, 0 }, 
05028                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 4 }, 
05029                                  { 2, 3 }, { 3, 4 }, 
05030                                  { 3, 0 } };
05031   // prismMap: 4 for 1st face, 3 for 2nd face, 2 for 4rd face, 0 for base & top
05032   VertexIDPair prismMap[9] =   { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 4 }, { 4, 3 }, { 3, 0 }, 
05033                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 5 }, { 5, 4 }, 
05034                                  { 2, 0 }, { 3, 5 } };
05035   // hexMap: 4 for 1st face, 3 for 2nd & 3rd face, 2 for 4th face, 0 for b&t 
05036   VertexIDPair hexMap[12] =    { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 5 }, { 5, 4 }, { 4, 0 },
05037                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 6 }, { 6, 5 }, 
05038                                  { 2, 3 }, { 3, 7 }, { 7, 6 }, 
05039                                  { 3, 0 }, { 4, 7 } };
05040   // store edges in set of blob arrays, one for each vertex where the vertex
05041   // it is stored in is the first vertex of the edge after "sorting"
05042   // A sorted edge has the smaller vertID first
05043   // some will have multiple edges, some will have none
05044   FC_SortedBlobArray* edgeLists; // numVertex long
05045   _EdgeBlob *edgeBlob;
05046 
05047   // log
05048   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
05049 
05050   // setup I, assume all elements are of same type
05051   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, &numVertex, &numElement, &elemType);
05052   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05053     return rc;
05054   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemConns);
05055   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05056     return rc;
05057   
05058   // handle the element type & pick the vertex map
05059   switch (elemType) {
05060   case FC_ET_POINT:
05061     // no edges for point elements, so no references to edges for verts
05062     meshSlot->numEdge = 0;    
05063     return FC_SUCCESS;  
05064   case FC_ET_LINE:     map = lineMap;     break;
05065   case FC_ET_TRI:      map = triMap;      break;
05066   case FC_ET_QUAD:     map = quadMap;     break;
05067   case FC_ET_TET:      map = tetMap;      break;
05068   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  map = pyramidMap;  break;
05069   case FC_ET_PRISM:    map = prismMap;    break;
05070   case FC_ET_HEX:      map = hexMap;      break;
05071   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
05072   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:
05073     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't do element type %s",
05074                           fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
05075     return FC_ERROR;
05076   }
05077 
05078   // setup II
05079   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
05080   numEdgePerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumEdge(elemType);
05081   // assuming that calloc will get me same results as fc_initSortedBlobArray
05082   edgeLists = (FC_SortedBlobArray*)calloc(numVertex, sizeof(FC_SortedBlobArray));
05083   if (edgeLists == NULL) {
05084     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05085     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05086   }
05087 
05088   // Find unique edges, filling in each element's edgeIDs array as we go
05089   elemToEdgeConns = malloc(numElement*numEdgePerElem*sizeof(int));
05090   if (elemToEdgeConns == NULL) {
05091     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05092     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05093   }
05094   numEdge = 0;
05095   // for each element:
05096   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
05097     
05098     // for each edge
05099     for (j = 0; j < numEdgePerElem; j++) {
05100       int foundBlob, blobIdx;
05101       
05102       // get and sort edge's vertexIDs
05103       for (k = 0; k < 2; k++)
05104         vertexIDs[k] = elemConns[i*numVertPerElem+map[j][k]];
05105       if (vertexIDs[0] > vertexIDs[1]) {
05106         temp_ID = vertexIDs[0];
05107         vertexIDs[0] = vertexIDs[1];
05108         vertexIDs[1] = temp_ID;
05109       }
05110       
05111       // look in edgeList of first vertex for edge with 2nd vertex
05112       _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]], &vertexIDs[1],
05113                           fc_intCompare, &foundBlob, &blobIdx);
05114       if (foundBlob)  {
05115      edgeBlob = edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]].blobs[blobIdx];
05116       }
05117       else { // make an edge
05118      edgeBlob = (_EdgeBlob*)malloc(sizeof(_EdgeBlob));
05119         if (edgeBlob == NULL) {
05120           fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05121           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05122         }  
05123         edgeBlob->endVert = vertexIDs[1];
05124         edgeBlob->edgeID = numEdge;
05125      _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]], blobIdx, 
05126                           edgeBlob);
05127         numEdge++;
05128       }
05129       elemToEdgeConns[i*numEdgePerElem+j] = edgeBlob->edgeID;
05130     }
05131   }
05132   
05133   // now build the edgeConns & edges array by walking array of edge lists
05134   edgeConns = malloc(2*numEdge*sizeof(int));
05135   if (edgeConns == NULL) {
05136     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05137     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05138   } 
05139   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
05140     for (j = 0; j < edgeLists[i].numBlob; j++) {
05141       edgeBlob = (_EdgeBlob*)edgeLists[i].blobs[j];
05142       temp_ID = edgeBlob->edgeID;
05143       edgeConns[2*temp_ID] = i;
05144       edgeConns[2*temp_ID + 1] = edgeBlob->endVert;
05145       free(edgeBlob);
05146     }
05147     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[i]);
05148   } 
05149   free(edgeLists);
05150 
05151   // set output
05152   meshSlot->numEdge = numEdge;
05153   meshSlot->edgeToVertConns = edgeConns;
05154   meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = elemToEdgeConns;
05155 
05156   return FC_SUCCESS;
05157 }
05158 
05159 /**
05160  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
05161  * \brief Special data blob for sorting faces.
05162  *
05163  * \description
05164  *
05165  *    Used only by _fc_faceNode_compare() in _fc_buildFaces().
05166  */
05167 typedef struct {
05168   FC_ElementType faceType;
05169   int vertexIDs[4];   // faces won't have more than 4 vertices
05170   int numVertex;
05171   int faceID;
05172 } _FaceBlob;
05173 
05174 /**
05175  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
05176  * \brief Compare two faces
05177  *
05178  * \description
05179  *
05180  *    To be used in this file (mesh.c) only for comparing faces.
05181  *    Expects faces to already be sorted so that smallest node ID
05182  *    is first and 2nd smallest vertex ID is next. (The order of the
05183  *    last 1 or 2 vertices is set by PATRAN ordering conventions.)
05184  *
05185  *    This method returns -1 if the first face's vertex IDs
05186  *    are smaller than the 2nd face's, 0 if the faces are the same;
05187  *    and 1 if the first face's vertex IDs are greater than the 2nd's.
05188  *
05189  *    Note, only the 1st 3 vertices are compared. In well behaved meshes, this
05190  *    should be suffient to compare faces. (I.e. we are assuming that quads
05191  *    will share 1, 2 or 4 vertices, but never just 3--if 3 are the same, all 4
05192  *    will be the same. We are also assuming that tris will not be "inside a
05193  *    quad" and therefore share 3 vertices.)
05194  *
05195  * \modifications
05196  *    - 10/10/2005 WSD. Promoted. Used to be inside _fc_buildFaces() but static
05197  *      functions not allowed inside funtions in gcc 4.0.
05198  */
05199 static int _faceBlob_compare(const void* node1, const void* node2) {
05200   const _FaceBlob* faceNode1 = (const _FaceBlob*)node1;
05201   const _FaceBlob* faceNode2 = (const _FaceBlob*)node2;
05202   
05203   if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[0] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[0]) 
05204     return -1;
05205   else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[0] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[0])
05206     return 1;
05207   else {
05208     if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[1] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[1])
05209       return -1;
05210     else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[1] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[1])
05211       return 1;
05212     else {
05213       if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[2] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[2])
05214         return -1;
05215       else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[2] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[2])
05216         return 1;
05217       else 
05218         return 0;
05219     }
05220   }
05221 };
05222 
05223 /**
05224  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05225  * \brief Build the face info for the mesh
05226  *
05227  * \description
05228  *  
05229  *    Finds the unique list of faces for the given set of elements.
05230  *    It also adds faceIDs arrays to each element.
05231  *    The vertices in each face are ordered so that the "smallest"
05232  *    edge is first. That is, the smallest ID is first, then the
05233  *    edge from that vertex that has the smaller 2nd ID is next.
05234  *
05235  *    Assumes that if comparing first 3 vertices of two face and
05236  *    they are the same, it is the same face (follows from assuming 
05237  *    planar faces or some kind of well behaved mesh).
05238  *
05239  *    When the face type is FC_ET_MIXED (i.e. mix of triangles and quads
05240  *    for pyramid and prism meshes), the returned connectivity array
05241  *    will be of the size numFace*maxNumVertPerFace and for faces
05242  *    that have fewer vertices than maxNumVertPerFace, the remaining
05243  *    entries for that face will have values of -1. Although this
05244  *    takes up more space, this organization makes it easier to
05245  *    index to a particular face.
05246  *
05247  * \todo Make it so that unique faces will have orient of 1 in their element.
05248  *
05249  * \modifications   
05250  *    - 02/03/04 WSK, Created
05251  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
05252  *    - 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections
05253  *      to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
05254  */
05255 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildFaceConns(
05256   FC_Mesh mesh       /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
05257 ) { 
05258   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05259   int i, j, k;
05260   int numVertex, numElement, *elemConns;
05261   int numVertPerElem, numFacePerElem, numFace, maxNumVertPerFace;
05262   int idx, temp_ID, numVertexID;
05263   int* numVertPerFace, *faceConns, *elemToFaceConns, *elemFaceOrients;
05264   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
05265   FC_ElementType elemType, faceType, *faceTypes;
05266   typedef int VertexIDSet[4]; // faces can have maximum of 4 vertices
05267   int temp_vertexIDs[7]; // 2*n -1
05268   FC_ElementType* faceTypeMap;
05269   FC_ElementType triFaceTypeMap[1] =     { FC_ET_TRI };
05270   FC_ElementType quadFaceTypeMap[1] =    { FC_ET_QUAD };
05271   FC_ElementType tetFaceTypeMap[4] =     { FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, 
05272                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI };
05273   FC_ElementType pyramidFaceTypeMap[5] = { FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, 
05274                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_QUAD };
05275   FC_ElementType prismFaceTypeMap[5] =   { FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,
05276                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI };
05277   FC_ElementType hexFaceTypeMap[6] =     { FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,
05278                                          FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,};
05279   VertexIDSet* map; // map element's vertex to it's faces vertices
05280   // Faces use exodus ordering 
05281   VertexIDSet triMap[1] =     { { 0, 1, 2, -1 } };
05282   VertexIDSet quadMap[1] =    { { 0, 1, 2, 3 } };
05283   // tetMap: 3 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base
05284   VertexIDSet tetMap[4] =     { { 0, 1, 3, -1 }, 
05285                                 { 1, 2, 3, -1 }, 
05286                                 { 0, 3, 2, -1 },
05287                                 { 0, 2, 1, -1 } }; 
05288   // pyramidMap: 4 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base
05289   VertexIDSet pyramidMap[8] = { { 0, 1, 4, -1 }, 
05290                                 { 1, 2, 4, -1 },
05291                                 { 2, 3, 4, -1 },
05292                                 { 0, 4, 3, -1 },
05293                                 { 0, 3, 2, 1 } };
05294   // prismMap: 3 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base & top
05295   VertexIDSet prismMap[9] =   { { 0, 1, 4, 3 },
05296                                 { 1, 2, 5, 4 }, 
05297                                 { 0, 3, 5, 2 }, 
05298                                 { 0, 2, 1, -1 }, 
05299                                 { 3, 4, 5, -1 } }; 
05300   // hexMap: 4 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base & top
05301   VertexIDSet hexMap[6] =     { { 0, 1, 5, 4 }, 
05302                                 { 1, 2, 6, 5 }, 
05303                                 { 2, 3, 7, 6 }, 
05304                                 { 0, 4, 7, 3 }, 
05305                                 { 0, 3, 2, 1 },
05306                                 { 4, 5, 6, 7 } };
05307   // store faces in set of blob arrays, one for each vertex where the vertex
05308   // it is stored in is the first vertex of the face after "sorting"
05309   // A sorted face as the smallest vertID first, and the second smallest
05310   // vertID 2nd, the traversal order may have to be "flipped" to do this.
05311   // some will have multiple faces, some will have none
05312   FC_SortedBlobArray* faceLists;
05313   _FaceBlob tempFaceBlob, *faceBlob;
05314 
05315   // log
05316   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
05317 
05318   // setup I, assume all elements are of same type
05319   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, &numVertex, &numElement, &elemType);
05320   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05321     return rc;
05322   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemConns);
05323   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05324     return rc;
05325 
05326   // handle the element type & pick the vertex map & faceType
05327   switch (elemType) {
05328   case FC_ET_POINT:    // fall through to FC_ET_LINE!   
05329   case FC_ET_LINE:
05330     // no faces
05331     meshSlot->numFace = 0;      
05332     return FC_SUCCESS; 
05333   case FC_ET_TRI:    map = triMap;    faceTypeMap = triFaceTypeMap;    break;
05334   case FC_ET_QUAD:   map = quadMap;   faceTypeMap = quadFaceTypeMap;   break;
05335   case FC_ET_TET:    map = tetMap;    faceTypeMap = tetFaceTypeMap;    break;
05336   case FC_ET_PYRAMID: map = pyramidMap; faceTypeMap = pyramidFaceTypeMap; break;
05337   case FC_ET_PRISM:  map = prismMap;  faceTypeMap = prismFaceTypeMap;  break;
05338   case FC_ET_HEX:    map = hexMap;    faceTypeMap = hexFaceTypeMap;    break;
05339   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
05340   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:
05341     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't do element type %s",
05342                           fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
05343     return FC_ERROR;
05344   }
05345   // if points or lines, don't need to make face list
05346 
05347   // setup II
05348   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
05349   numFacePerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumFace(elemType);
05350   // assuming that calloc will get me same results as fc_initSortedBlobArray
05351   faceLists = (FC_SortedBlobArray*)calloc(numVertex, sizeof(FC_SortedBlobArray));
05352   if (faceLists == NULL) {
05353     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05354     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05355   }
05356 
05357   // Find unique faces, filling in each element's faceIDs array as we go
05358   //printf("numVertex = %d, numElement = %d\n", numVertex, numElement);
05359   elemToFaceConns = malloc(numElement*numFacePerElem*sizeof(int));
05360   elemFaceOrients = malloc(numElement*numFacePerElem*sizeof(int));
05361   if (elemToFaceConns == NULL || elemFaceOrients == NULL) {
05362     free(elemToFaceConns);
05363     free(elemFaceOrients);
05364     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05365     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05366   }
05367   numFace = 0;
05368   // for each element:
05369   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
05370 
05371     // for each face
05372     for (j = 0; j < numFacePerElem; j++) {
05373       int foundBlob, blobIdx;
05374       numVertexID = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceTypeMap[j]);
05375       
05376       // get face's vertexIDs
05377       for (k = 0; k < numVertexID; k++)
05378         temp_vertexIDs[k] = elemConns[i*numVertPerElem+map[j][k]];
05379 
05380       // rotate array so smallest ID is first (keep order)
05381       idx = 0;
05382       temp_ID = temp_vertexIDs[0];
05383       for (k = 1; k < numVertexID; k++) {
05384         if (temp_vertexIDs[k] < temp_ID) {
05385           idx = k;
05386           temp_ID = temp_vertexIDs[k];
05387         }
05388       }
05389       for (k = 0; k < idx; k++) 
05390         temp_vertexIDs[numVertexID + k] = temp_vertexIDs[k];
05391 
05392       // Fill in temporary face
05393       tempFaceBlob.faceType = faceTypeMap[j];
05394       tempFaceBlob.numVertex = numVertexID;
05395 
05396       // Make the vertex array, & flip orientation if needed
05397       if (temp_vertexIDs[idx + 1] < temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - 1]) {        
05398         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = 1;
05399         for (k = 0; k < numVertexID; k++)
05400           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[k+idx];
05401       }
05402       else {
05403         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = -1;
05404         tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0] = temp_vertexIDs[idx];
05405         for (k = 1; k < numVertexID; k++)
05406           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - k];
05407       }
05408 
05409       // look for entry in faceLists based on first vertex
05410       _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
05411                           &tempFaceBlob, _faceBlob_compare,
05412                           &foundBlob, &blobIdx);
05413       if (foundBlob) {
05414      faceBlob = faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]].blobs[blobIdx];
05415       }
05416       else { // make a new face
05417      faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)malloc(sizeof(_FaceBlob));
05418      if (faceBlob == NULL) {
05419        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05420           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05421      }
05422      *faceBlob = tempFaceBlob; // check me!
05423         faceBlob->faceID = numFace;
05424      _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
05425                           blobIdx, faceBlob);
05426         numFace++;
05427       }
05428       elemToFaceConns[i*numFacePerElem+j] = faceBlob->faceID;
05429     }
05430   }
05431 
05432   // now build the faceTypes, numVertPerFace, faceConns and faces arrays by walking array
05433   // of face lists
05434   faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(elemType);
05435   maxNumVertPerFace = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceType);
05436   if (maxNumVertPerFace < 0 && faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
05437     maxNumVertPerFace = 4; // only pyramids & prisms have mixed face type
05438   faceTypes = malloc(numFace*sizeof(FC_ElementType));
05439   numVertPerFace = malloc(numFace*sizeof(int));
05440   faceConns = malloc(numFace*maxNumVertPerFace*sizeof(int));
05441   if (faceTypes == NULL || numVertPerFace == NULL || faceConns == NULL) {
05442     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05443     free(faceTypes);
05444     free(numVertPerFace);
05445     free(faceConns);
05446     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05447   }
05448   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
05449     for (j = 0; j < faceLists[i].numBlob; j++) {
05450       faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)faceLists[i].blobs[j];
05451       temp_ID = faceBlob->faceID;
05452       faceTypes[temp_ID] = faceBlob->faceType;
05453       numVertPerFace[temp_ID] = faceBlob->numVertex;
05454       memcpy(&faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID], faceBlob->vertexIDs,
05455              faceBlob->numVertex*sizeof(int));
05456       for (k = faceBlob->numVertex; k < maxNumVertPerFace; k++)
05457         faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID + k] = -1;
05458       free(faceBlob);
05459     }
05460     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[i]);
05461   } 
05462   free(faceLists);
05463 
05464   // set output
05465   meshSlot->numFace = numFace;
05466   meshSlot->faceTypes = faceTypes;
05467   meshSlot->numVertPerFace = numVertPerFace;
05468   meshSlot->faceToVertConns = faceConns;
05469   meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = elemToFaceConns;
05470   meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = elemFaceOrients;
05471 
05472   return FC_SUCCESS;
05473 }
05474 
05475 /**
05476  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05477  * \brief Build the neighbor information for the vertices array
05478  *
05479  * \description  
05480  *
05481  * \modifications   
05482  *    - WSK 02/24/04 WSK, created to build quick lookups for vertex neighbors
05483  *    - WSK 07/15/04 WSK, now only builds "edge" neighbors
05484  *    - WSK 10/31/05 WSK, takes mesh as argument instead of all the
05485  *      stuf it needs.
05486  */
05487 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshVertexNeighborsViaEdge(
05488   FC_Mesh mesh   /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
05489 ) {
05490   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05491   int i;
05492   int numVert, numEdge, *edgeConns;
05493   int* numVertNeighsViaEdge, **vertNeighsViaEdge;
05494   _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
05495   FC_SortedIntArray *lists;  // a list of neighbor IDs
05496   
05497   // check inputs
05498   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh)) {
05499     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05500     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05501   }
05502   
05503   // log message
05504   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
05505   fc_printfLogMessage("Building vertex neighbors via edge on mesh '%s'", 
05506                       meshSlot->header.name);
05507   
05508   // setup
05509   rc = fc_getMeshNumVertex(mesh, &numVert);
05510   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05511     return rc;
05512   rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
05513   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05514     return rc;
05515 
05516   // A little more checking
05517   if (numEdge < 1)
05518     return FC_SUCCESS; // Nothing to do
05519 
05520   // More setup
05521   rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &edgeConns);
05522   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05523     return rc;
05524 
05525   // for each edge, add each vertex to the other vertex's list
05526   lists = malloc(numVert*sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
05527   if (lists == NULL) {
05528     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05529     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05530   }
05531   for (i = 0; i < numVert; i++)
05532     fc_initSortedIntArray(&lists[i]);
05533   for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) {
05534     int ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[edgeConns[i*2+1]], edgeConns[i*2]);
05535     if (ret < 0) {
05536       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
05537       return ret;
05538     }
05539     ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[edgeConns[i*2]], edgeConns[i*2+1]);
05540     if (ret < 0) {
05541       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
05542       return ret;
05543     }
05544   }
05545 
05546   // convert neigh lists to arrays & store on mesh
05547   numVertNeighsViaEdge = (int*)malloc(numVert*sizeof(int));
05548   vertNeighsViaEdge = (int**)malloc(numVert*sizeof(int*));
05549   if (numVertNeighsViaEdge == NULL || vertNeighsViaEdge == NULL) {
05550     free(numVertNeighsViaEdge);
05551     free(vertNeighsViaEdge);
05552     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05553     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05554   }
05555   for (i = 0; i < numVert; i++) {
05556     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&(lists[i]), &(numVertNeighsViaEdge[i]),
05557                                 &(vertNeighsViaEdge[i]));
05558     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05559       return rc;
05560   }
05561   free(lists);
05562 
05563   // set results on mesh
05564   meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge = numVertNeighsViaEdge;
05565   meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge = vertNeighsViaEdge;
05566 
05567   return FC_SUCCESS;
05568 }
05569 
05570 /**
05571  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
05572  * \brief Build element neighbors that share the specified entity type.
05573  *
05574  * \description
05575  *
05576  *    Computes the big data arrays that store number of element neighbors
05577  *    per element and the ids of those neighbors.
05578  *
05579  *    This is a helper and should only be called internally. It doesn't
05580  *    have robust checking.
05581  *
05582  * \modifications
05583  *    - 10/31/2005 WSD. Created to replace _fc_buildElementNeighbors.
05584  *      Since the code is essentially the same for three possible
05585  *      share entity types, replace 3 specific versions with 1 general one.
05586  */
05587 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(
05588   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
05589   FC_AssociationType sharedType /**< The type of shared entity */ 
05590 ) {
05591   FC_ReturnCode rc, rc2;
05592   int i, j;
05593   int numElem, numEntity, numEntityPerElem, entityID;
05594   int *elemToEntityConns, *numElemPerEntity, **elemParentsPerEntity;
05595   int *numElemNeighsViaEntity, **elemNeighsViaEntity;
05596   _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
05597   FC_ElementType elemType;
05598   FC_SortedIntArray list; // list for each element
05599 
05600   // check inputs
05601   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(sharedType) || 
05602       sharedType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || sharedType >= FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
05603     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05604     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05605   }
05606   // FIX?: Check that entity has topodim less than element
05607 
05608   // log message
05609   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
05610   fc_printfLogMessage("Building element neighbors via '%s' on mesh '%s'", 
05611                       fc_getAssociationTypeText(sharedType),
05612                       meshSlot->header.name);
05613 
05614   // setup
05615   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, NULL, &numElem, &elemType);
05616   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05617     return rc;
05618   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, sharedType, &numEntity);
05619   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05620     return rc;
05621   numEntityPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumEntity(elemType, sharedType);
05622 
05623   // A little more checking
05624   if (numEntity < 1) 
05625     return FC_SUCCESS; // Nothing to do
05626 
05627   // More setup 
05628   // FIX: replace this if wrapper calls become available
05629   switch(sharedType) {
05630   case FC_AT_VERTEX:
05631     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
05632     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfVerticesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
05633                                              &elemParentsPerEntity);
05634     break;
05635   case FC_AT_EDGE:
05636     rc = fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
05637     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfEdgesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
05638                                            &elemParentsPerEntity);
05639     break;
05640   case FC_AT_FACE:
05641     rc = fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
05642     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfFacesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
05643                                            &elemParentsPerEntity);
05644     break;
05645   default :
05646     ; // nothing
05647   }
05648   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05649     return rc;
05650   if (rc2 != FC_SUCCESS)
05651     return rc2;
05652 
05653   // FIX? different algorithm
05654   // This *might* be faster but will use more memory
05655   // For each entity, add it's parents to each other's lists
05656   // for (i = 0; i < numEntity; i++) {
05657   //   for (j = 0; j < numElemPerEntity[i]; j++) {
05658   //     for (k = 0; k < numElemPerEntity[i]; k++) {
05659   //       if (j != k) {
05660   //          fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&list[k], elemParentsPerEntity[i][j]);
05661   //          fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&list[j], elemParentsPerEntity[i][k]);
05662   //       }
05663   //     } 
05664   //   }
05665   // }
05666 
05667   // find neighbors
05668   numElemNeighsViaEntity = (int*)malloc(numElem*sizeof(int));
05669   elemNeighsViaEntity = (int**)malloc(numElem*sizeof(int*));
05670   if (numElemNeighsViaEntity == NULL || elemNeighsViaEntity == NULL) {
05671     free(numElemNeighsViaEntity);
05672     free(elemNeighsViaEntity);
05673     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05674     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05675   }
05676   for (i = 0; i < numElem; i++) {
05677     fc_initSortedIntArray(&list);
05678     for (j = 0; j < numEntityPerElem; j++) {
05679       entityID = elemToEntityConns[i*numEntityPerElem+j];
05680       int ret = fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(&list,
05681                                 numElemPerEntity[entityID],
05682                                 elemParentsPerEntity[entityID],
05683                                 0);
05684       if (ret < 0) {
05685      fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add entry to sia");
05686      return ret;    
05687       }
05688     }
05689     fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(&list, i); // don't count this elem
05690     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&list, &numElemNeighsViaEntity[i],
05691                                 &elemNeighsViaEntity[i]);
05692     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05693       return rc;
05694   }
05695  
05696   // Set results on mesh
05697   // FIX?: pass array pointer to function call?
05698   switch(sharedType) {
05699   case FC_AT_VERTEX:
05700     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
05701     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert = elemNeighsViaEntity;
05702     break;
05703   case FC_AT_EDGE:
05704     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
05705     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge = elemNeighsViaEntity;
05706     break;
05707   case FC_AT_FACE:
05708     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
05709     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace = elemNeighsViaEntity;
05710     break;
05711   default :
05712     ; // nothing
05713   }
05714 
05715   return FC_SUCCESS;
05716 }
05717 
05718 /**
05719  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05720  * \brief  Initialize a mesh slot
05721  *
05722  * \modifications  
05723  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created. 
05724  *   03-03-08 ACG adding sequence subsets
05725  */
05726 void _fc_initMeshSlot(
05727   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot    /**< input - the mtable slot to initialize */
05728 ) {
05729   // Note: tried to use the same order of members as the meshSlot declaration
05730   if (meshSlot != NULL) {
05731     _fc_initSlotHeader(&meshSlot->header);
05732     meshSlot->ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
05733     //---
05734     meshSlot->fileInfo.id = -1;
05735     //---
05736     meshSlot->dim = 0;
05737     meshSlot->topodim = 0;
05738     meshSlot->numVertex = 0;
05739     meshSlot->numElement = 0;
05740     meshSlot->elemType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
05741     //---
05742     meshSlot->coords = NULL;
05743     meshSlot->elemToVertConns = NULL;
05744     //--
05745     meshSlot->numEdge = -1;
05746     meshSlot->numFace = -1;
05747     meshSlot->edgeToVertConns = NULL;
05748     meshSlot->faceTypes = NULL;
05749     meshSlot->numVertPerFace = NULL;
05750     meshSlot->faceToVertConns = NULL;
05751     meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = NULL;
05752     meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = NULL;
05753     meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = NULL;
05754     //---
05755     meshSlot->numEdgePerVert = NULL;
05756     meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
05757     meshSlot->numFacePerVert = NULL;
05758     meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
05759     meshSlot->numElemPerVert = NULL;
05760     meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
05761     meshSlot->numElemPerEdge = NULL;
05762     meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
05763     meshSlot->numElemPerFace = NULL;
05764     meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
05765     //---
05766     meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05767     meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05768     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05769     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05770     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05771     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05772     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05773     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05774     //---
05775     meshSlot->numSub = 0;
05776     meshSlot->subIDs = NULL;
05777     meshSlot->numSeqSub = 0;
05778     meshSlot->numStepPerSeqSub = NULL;
05779     meshSlot->seqSubIDs = NULL;
05780     //---
05781     meshSlot->coordVarID = -1;
05782     meshSlot->numBasicVar = 0;
05783     meshSlot->basicVarIDs = NULL;
05784     meshSlot->numSeqVar = 0;
05785     meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar = NULL;
05786     meshSlot->seqVarIDs = NULL;
05787   }   
05788 }
05789 
05790 /**
05791  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05792  * \brief  Release non-necessary information in a mesh slot.
05793  *
05794  * \description
05795  *  
05796  *    Releases the coordinates, connectivities and topology
05797  *    structures.
05798  *
05799  * \todo Make this smarter ....
05800  *
05801  * \modifications  
05802  *   Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05803  */
05804 void _fc_releaseMeshSlot(
05805   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlotp    /**< input - mtable pointer */
05806 ) {
05807   int i;
05808 
05809   // release big data
05810   //---
05811   if (meshSlotp->coords) {
05812     free(meshSlotp->coords);
05813     meshSlotp->coords = NULL;
05814   }
05815   if (meshSlotp->elemToVertConns) {
05816     free(meshSlotp->elemToVertConns);
05817     meshSlotp->elemToVertConns = NULL;
05818   }
05819   //---
05820   if (meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns) {
05821     free(meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns);
05822     meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns = NULL;
05823   }
05824   if (meshSlotp->faceTypes) {
05825     free(meshSlotp->faceTypes);
05826     meshSlotp->faceTypes = NULL;
05827   }
05828   if (meshSlotp->numVertPerFace) {
05829     free(meshSlotp->numVertPerFace);
05830     meshSlotp->numVertPerFace = NULL;
05831   }
05832   if (meshSlotp->faceToVertConns) {
05833     free(meshSlotp->faceToVertConns);
05834     meshSlotp->faceToVertConns = NULL;
05835   }
05836   if (meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns) {
05837     free(meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns);
05838     meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns = NULL;
05839   }
05840   if (meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns) {
05841     free(meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns);
05842     meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns = NULL;
05843   }
05844   if (meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients) {
05845     free(meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients);
05846     meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients = NULL;
05847   }
05848   //---
05849   if (meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert) {
05850     free(meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert);
05851     meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert = NULL;
05852   }
05853   if (meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert) {
05854     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05855       free(meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert[i]);
05856     free(meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert);
05857     meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
05858   }
05859   if (meshSlotp->numFacePerVert) {
05860     free(meshSlotp->numFacePerVert);
05861     meshSlotp->numFacePerVert = NULL;
05862   }
05863   if (meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert) {
05864     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05865       free(meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert[i]);
05866     free(meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert);
05867     meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
05868   }
05869   if (meshSlotp->numElemPerVert) {
05870     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerVert);
05871     meshSlotp->numElemPerVert = NULL;
05872   }
05873   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert) {
05874     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05875       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert[i]);
05876     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert);
05877     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
05878   }
05879   if (meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge) {
05880     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge);
05881     meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge = NULL;
05882   }
05883   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge) {
05884     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numEdge; i++)
05885       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge[i]);
05886     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge);
05887     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
05888   }
05889    if (meshSlotp->numElemPerFace) {
05890     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerFace);
05891     meshSlotp->numElemPerFace = NULL;
05892   }
05893   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace) {
05894     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numFace; i++)
05895       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace[i]);
05896     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace);
05897     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
05898   }
05899   //---
05900   if (meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge) {
05901     free(meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge);
05902     meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05903   }
05904   if (meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge) {
05905     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05906       free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge[i]);
05907     free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge);
05908     meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05909   }
05910   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert) {
05911     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert);
05912     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05913   }
05914   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert) {
05915     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05916       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert[i]);
05917     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert);
05918     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05919   }
05920   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge) {
05921     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge);
05922     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05923   }
05924   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge) {
05925     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05926       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge[i]);
05927     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge);
05928     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05929   }
05930   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace) {
05931     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace);
05932     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05933   }
05934   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace) {
05935     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05936       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace[i]);
05937     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace);
05938     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05939   }
05940 
05941   //---
05942   meshSlotp->numEdge = -1;
05943   meshSlotp->numFace = -1;
05944   
05945   return;
05946 }
05947 
05948 /**
05949  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05950  * \brief  Clear a mesh slot.
05951  *
05952  * \description
05953  *  
05954  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a mesh,
05955  *    and reinitializes all members.
05956  *
05957  * \modifications  
05958  *   - Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05959  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
05960  *   - 03-03-08 ACG added seqSubsets
05961  */
05962 void _fc_clearMeshSlot(
05963  _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlotp       /**< input - vtable pointer */
05964 ) {
05965   int i;
05966 
05967   if (meshSlotp != NULL) {
05968     // release big data
05969     _fc_releaseMeshSlot(meshSlotp);
05970 
05971     // free other dynamic arrays
05972     if (meshSlotp->subIDs)
05973       free(meshSlotp->subIDs);
05974     if (meshSlotp->seqSubIDs) {
05975       for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numSeqSub; i++)
05976      free(meshSlotp->seqSubIDs[i]);
05977       free(meshSlotp->seqSubIDs);
05978     }
05979     if (meshSlotp->basicVarIDs)
05980       free(meshSlotp->basicVarIDs);
05981     if (meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar)
05982       free(meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar);
05983     if (meshSlotp->seqVarIDs) {
05984       for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numSeqVar; i++)
05985      free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs[i]);
05986       free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs);
05987     }
05988 
05989     // clear table header
05990     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&meshSlotp->header);
05991 
05992     // reinit
05993     _fc_initMeshSlot(meshSlotp);
05994   }
05995 }
05996 
05997 /**
05998  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05999  * \brief  Get the size of the mesh table.
06000  *
06001  * \modifications  
06002  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
06003  */
06004 int _fc_getMeshTableSize() {
06005   return meshTableSize;
06006 }
06007 
06008 /**
06009  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06010  * \brief   Get an empty mesh slot from the mesh table.
06011  *
06012  * \description
06013  *  
06014  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
06015  *
06016  * \modifications  
06017  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
06018  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
06019  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
06020  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
06021  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
06022  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
06023  */
06024 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getNewMeshSlot() {
06025   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
06026 
06027   meshSlot = (_FC_MeshSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&meshTableSize, 
06028                              (_FC_SlotHeader***)&meshTable,
06029                            &meshOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_MeshSlot));
06030   _fc_initMeshSlot(meshSlot);
06031 
06032   return meshSlot;
06033 }
06034 
06035 /**
06036  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06037  *
06038  * \brief Get a mesh slot from a mesh handle.
06039  *
06040  * \description
06041  * 
06042  *    The slot id of the mesh handle is used to find the
06043  *    the slot in the mesh table. The identity is then
06044  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
06045  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
06046  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
06047  *
06048  * \modifications 
06049  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
06050  *       for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
06051  *       prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
06052  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
06053  */
06054 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlot(
06055   FC_Mesh mesh    /**< input - mesh */
06056 ) {
06057   if (_fc_isHandleValid(mesh.slotID, mesh.uID, meshTableSize,
06058                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable))
06059     return meshTable[mesh.slotID];
06060   else
06061     return NULL;
06062 }
06063 
06064 /**
06065  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06066  *
06067  * \brief Get a mesh slot based on ID.
06068  *
06069  * \description
06070  * 
06071  *    The _FC_MeshSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
06072  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
06073  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getMeshSlot.
06074  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
06075  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
06076  *
06077  * \modifications 
06078  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
06079  *      tables without knowing about them.
06080  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
06081  */
06082 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(
06083   int meshID
06084 ) {
06085   return (_FC_MeshSlot*) _fc_getSlot(meshID, meshTableSize, 
06086                                      (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable);
06087 }
06088 
06089 /**
06090  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06091  * \brief Delete the mesh slot associated with the mesh handle.
06092  *
06093  * \description 
06094  *    
06095  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
06096  *    deletes the slot from the table.
06097  *
06098  * \modifications
06099  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
06100  */
06101 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteMeshSlot(
06102   FC_Mesh mesh    /**< input - mesh */
06103 ) {
06104   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
06105   
06106   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
06107   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
06108     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06109     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06110   }
06111 
06112   // do it
06113   _fc_clearMeshSlot(meshSlot);
06114   return _fc_deleteSlot(meshSlot->header.slotID, meshTableSize, 
06115                (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable, &meshOpenSlots);
06116 }
06117 
06118 /**
06119  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06120  * \brief  Print the contents of the Mesh Table (\ref meshTable) to stderr.
06121  *
06122  * \description
06123  *
06124  *    Prints the contents of the Mesh Table in a human readable form.
06125  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
06126  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
06127  *
06128  * \modifications 
06129  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
06130  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
06131  *    - 03-03-08 ACG added seqSubset
06132  */
06133 void _fc_printMeshTable(
06134   char *label   /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
06135                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
06136 ) {
06137   int i, j, k;
06138   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
06139   
06140   // print table heading
06141   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
06142   fprintf(stderr, "Mesh Table (meshTable):\n");
06143   if (label != NULL)
06144     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
06145   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
06146   fflush(NULL);
06147 
06148   // We're done if it's empty
06149   if (meshTableSize < 1) {
06150     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
06151     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
06152     fflush(NULL);
06153     return;
06154   }
06155 
06156   // print contents for each slot
06157   for (i = 0; i <  meshTableSize; i++) {
06158     meshSlot = meshTable[i];
06159     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (meshSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06160     if (meshSlot == NULL)
06161       continue;
06162     _fc_printSlotHeader(meshSlot->header);
06163     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Dataset = { %d, %d }\n",
06164             meshSlot->ds.slotID, meshSlot->ds.uID);
06165     fprintf(stderr, "     dim = %d, topodim = %d\n", 
06166             meshSlot->dim, meshSlot->topodim);
06167     fprintf(stderr, "     numVertex = %d, coords = %s\n",
06168             meshSlot->numVertex, (meshSlot->coords) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06169     fprintf(stderr, "     numElement = %d, elemType = %s, elemConns = %s\n",
06170             meshSlot->numElement, fc_getElementTypeText(meshSlot->elemType), 
06171             (meshSlot->elemToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06172     fprintf(stderr, "     numEdge = %d, edgeConns = %s, elemToEdgeConns = %s\n",
06173             meshSlot->numEdge, (meshSlot->edgeToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06174             (meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06175     fprintf(stderr, "     numFace = %d, faceType = %s, faceTypes = %s\n", 
06176             meshSlot->numFace,
06177             fc_getElementTypeText(fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType)),
06178             (meshSlot->faceTypes) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06179     fprintf(stderr, "         numVertPerFace = %s, faceConns = %s\n",
06180             (meshSlot->numVertPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
06181             (meshSlot->faceToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06182     fprintf(stderr, "         elemToFaceConns = %s, elemFaceOrients = %s\n",
06183             (meshSlot->elemToFaceConns) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06184             (meshSlot->elemFaceOrients) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06185     fprintf(stderr, "     numEdgePerVert = %s, edgeParentsPerVert = %s\n",
06186             (meshSlot->numEdgePerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06187             (meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06188     fprintf(stderr, "     numFacePerVert = %s, faceParentsPerVert = %s\n",
06189             (meshSlot->numFacePerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06190             (meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06191     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerVert = %s, elemParentsPerVert = %s\n",
06192             (meshSlot->numElemPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06193             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06194     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerEdge = %s, elemParentsPerEdge = %s\n",
06195             (meshSlot->numElemPerEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06196             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06197     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerFace = %s, elemParentsPerFace = %s\n",
06198             (meshSlot->numElemPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL",
06199             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06200     fprintf(stderr, "     numVertNeighsViaEdge = %s, vertNeighsViaEdge = %s\n",
06201             (meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
06202             (meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06203     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaVert = %s, elemNeighsViaVert = %s\n",
06204             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
06205             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06206     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaEdge = %s, elemNeighsViaEdge = %s\n",
06207             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
06208             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06209     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaFace = %s, elemNeighsViaFace = %s\n",
06210             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
06211             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace) ? "exists" : "NULL");
06212     fprintf(stderr, "     numSub = %d, subIDs = ", meshSlot->numSub);
06213     if (meshSlot->numSub == 0) 
06214       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
06215     else {
06216       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->subIDs[0]);
06217       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numSub; j++)
06218         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->subIDs[j]);
06219       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
06220     }
06221     fprintf(stderr, "     numSeqSub = %d, seqSubIDs = ", meshSlot->numSeqSub);
06222     if (!meshSlot->seqSubIDs)
06223       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
06224     else {
06225       fprintf(stderr, "{\n");
06226       for (j = 0; j < meshSlot->numSeqSub; j++) {
06227      fprintf(stderr, "         seqSubIDs[%d] = { %d", j, 
06228                   meshSlot->seqSubIDs[j][0]);
06229      for (k = 1; k < meshSlot->numStepPerSeqSub[j]; k++)
06230        fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->seqSubIDs[j][k]);
06231      fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
06232       }
06233       fprintf(stderr, "     }\n");
06234     }
06235     fprintf(stderr, "     coordVarID = %d\n", meshSlot->coordVarID); 
06236     fprintf(stderr, "     numBasicVar = %d, basicVarIDs = ", 
06237             meshSlot->numBasicVar);
06238     if (meshSlot->numBasicVar == 0) 
06239       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
06240     else {
06241       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->basicVarIDs[0]);
06242       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numBasicVar; j++)
06243         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->basicVarIDs[j]);
06244       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
06245     }
06246     fprintf(stderr, "     numSeqVar = %d, numStepPerSeqVar = ", meshSlot->numSeqVar);
06247     if (!meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar)
06248       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
06249     else {
06250       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[0]);
06251       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++)
06252         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]);
06253       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
06254     }
06255     fprintf(stderr, "     seqVarIDs = ");
06256     if (!meshSlot->seqVarIDs) 
06257       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
06258     else {
06259       fprintf(stderr, "{\n");
06260       for (j = 0; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++) {
06261      fprintf(stderr, "         seqVarIDs[%d] = { %d", j, 
06262                   meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][0]);
06263      for (k = 1; k < meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]; k++)
06264        fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][k]);
06265      fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
06266       }
06267       fprintf(stderr, "     }\n");
06268     }
06269     fflush(NULL);
06270   }
06271   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
06272   fflush(NULL);
06273 
06274   return;
06275 }
06276 
06277 /**
06278  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
06279  * \brief  Free all entries in the mesh table
06280  *
06281  * \description
06282  *
06283  *    This should only be called after making sure that
06284  *    all slots have been cleared.
06285  *
06286  * \modifications  
06287  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
06288  */
06289 void _fc_freeMeshTable() {
06290   int i;
06291   for (i = 0; i < meshTableSize; i++) {
06292     _fc_clearMeshSlot(meshTable[i]);
06293     free(meshTable[i]);
06294   }
06295   free(meshTable);
06296   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&meshOpenSlots);
06297   meshTableSize = 0;
06298   meshTable = NULL;
06299 }
